Reviews.Title: “4 Day break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: julian G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tilssit Hotel for our wedding aniversery and were delighted to find our room decked out with chocolates rose petals, a bottle of wine, and a wecolming card The staff could not be more pleasant and helpfull Excellent breakfast good choice something for everyone

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Dan M
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay in Paris where we stayed at the Hotel Tilsitt Etoile. The location of this hotel is perfect. A stone's throw from the Arc De Triomphe, we were able to jump on the metro and take in all the sights. The hotel itself has a boutique feel to it. Our double room could be considered on the small side but it was absolutely perfect for somewhere to crash out. Rooms in Parisian hotels are famed for being petite just as they like to cram as many people into bars, restaurants etc. Breakfast is a continental buffet which was more than sufficient. Again don't expect a full hot buffet with all the trimmings, most hotels in Paris will offer fresh pastries, hams, cheeses etc. Only down side was the lack of aircon which meant our room was hot at night and the fact that the lift broke on our penultimate night (we were on the 6th floor!). I would highly recommend this hotel as the place to stay for a great city break.

Reviews.Title: “Small room with very small bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Ken K
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms when we visited Paris with friends in October 2011. As I'm 6ft (190cm) tall, I should say the room is too small for me. Due to my big size, I had difficulty to properly sit down in the toilet. Our friends were complained about the aircon, as it was not cold at all. Nothing being offered thanks to the fully booked hotel at the time. As other says, I couldnt agree more in term of location. The location is simply the best, around 4 minutes walk from Arc de Triomphe. Should I say the lift is terribly old and slow too?

Reviews.Title: “Good place for business trips to La Défense disctrict”
Reviews.Author: RoelJewel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near Charles de Gaulle Etoile metro station which connects you to La Défense in 15 minutes. I stayed in this hotel when on a business trip to our office near La Défense. Rooms are nothing special, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Small. Clean. Friendly staff. Would go again”
Reviews.Author: Allesscheisse
Reviews.Content: As above. This was a surprise booked by my wife for my 50th. Been to higher rated hotels before. Room was nice and stylish. If I had 2 criticise it would be the creaking lift. Staff were friendly and helpful. It felt comfy, cozy or gemuetlich ( for german speakers).

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel near Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesCAtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with limited service and amenities but the rooms are quite modern, and very clean. The light morning self serve breakfast is perfect. Location is very good, near Arc de Triomphe and close to the Metro, nice restaurants, and a self-serve laundry. Room price was reasonable. I had a nice room on the ground floor with a little private patio, which was charming. I'd definitely stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel with large comfy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: THCheam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable with a large triple room. Wifi access throughout the hotel premises also offered great convenience. Staff were helpful and the little touches really made it a stay away from home. The view from our room was also nice as it gave us a view of the courtyard. Overall, comfy stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cute, clean, no frills boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jmrancou
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days, 7 nights for our tenth anniversary. It is a smallish hotel off the main drags (Rue Brey is an alleyway), but really close to the Etoile Metro, and all the shops surrounding the Arc de Triomphe. Check-in was a breeze, but initially we were assigned a room on the ground floor, which was very dissapointing, it had lots of road noise and pedestrian traffic right outside the window. We politely complained in our halting Canadian civil service French and were reassigned the next day into a room on the 6th floor (top floor, room 64) which had *two* balconies, (only big enough to stand on, no chairs or tables could ever fit), which was fantastic! (Thanks again, Sylwain, you're the best, you totally rescued our honeymoon!!!) The view was of Paris rooftops, and you can't see much in the way of landmarks, but was really beautiful all the same. The room was cozy, modern, well lit, clean (save for a tiny touch of ceiling mold here and there in the washroom, but nothing out of the ordinary for an 150-year old building), and the A/C worked flawlessly. There is no bathroom fan, and the only dressing mirror was in the bathroom - though this is not the same for each room, our first room on the ground floor had a dressing mirror outside, which is better. This was something which annoyed my wife to no end, but didn't even register with me. The heated towel racks were a nice touch, but the shower "curtain" is a swinging piece of glass over a very deep tub which was IMHO style over safety, I could see ingress/egress of the shower could be a bit of a problem for Grandma and Grandpa, but we didn't have any specific issues there. The hotel serves a modest all-you-can-eat continental breakfast downstairs in a pretty buffet room consisting of toast, croissants, meats, fresh cheese, fruit juice and yogurt. 15 € is a bit pricey, but you can't beat the service, the food is great, and there is the signifigant convenience factor to start your day. There isn't a lot of equivalent breakfast places on Brey within a one-block radius, aside from a couple of fast food places on Wagram, so I really reccomend eating at the Hotel. Then again, there is a Metroprix (basically an upscale Target/Walmart/Zellers) down the street a block, you could stock up on food there, but where is the romance in that? :-) We initially took the Metro from CDG airport all the way to Ternes, with bags, amd due to all the turnstiles and stairs, that method is *not* recommended. We took an airport shuttle from the hotel out to CDG for less than €30, and that was by far the best route. All in all we were very pleased with the hotel and would stay there again (maybe for our 20th :-) ), and totally reccomend the place. FYI, If you stay there, the best rooms are on the 5th and 6th floors...

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe it's not ranked higher on TA !”
Reviews.Author: saragio15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Tilsitt as the hotel I usually stay at (Magda Etolie which is also excellent) was fully booked Excellent location near the Arc De Triomphe, staff very friendly, very clean, room basic but adequate. Only minor niggles, safe was faulty and light switch temperamental I can't believe it's not ranked higher, recommend

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: RedJez
Reviews.Content: Stopprd here for two nights end September beginning October 2011. On arrival we were advised that we had been bounced out of our room at up the road to a sister hotel the Tivoli. Checked this out, but the rooms offered were tiny, so went back to Tilsitt and kicked up a bit of a fuss and we were eventually upgraded to a superior room. The room was ok, but hardly massive, very clean, the staff were very friendly and the breakfast was excellent, but I can't help but think you would be just as well off at a Novotel or simular!

Reviews.Title: “There are better locations, Nice room, staff not helpful, would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Steven B
Reviews.Content: The room was very "Frenchy" in a quiet street, short walk to Arc De Triomphe. Short walk to Metro, and Champs Elysses. The staff were friendly but not very knowledgeable about the area. For example, we wanted to do our laundry and didn't want to use the hotel's ridiculous priced laundry service (3.50 Euro to wash pair of socks!!) so we asked the desk for the nearest laundromat. He sent us 5 blocks away to a place that had shut down for months. On our way back, we stumbled on a laundry that was about 200m away round the corner! The airport shuttle service to the airport, was advertised as being 15 euro, but when we arrived we got a shock that it was just a booking fee? We spoke to the hotel and all they said was "upps we made a mistake" The safe kept locking me out, they were unable to fix it, slightly annoying. All in all I would NOT stay here again, and would find it hard to recommend to non French speaking people. In the same street 100m up, there is a,....Gentleman's club. Check out Google street view of the area if you doubt me. There are better hotels in this price range try St Germain area for a more Parisian experience IMHO.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay..helpful staff and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: dball98
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed her for 4 nights and had a great time! The location is awesome and only a couple of minutes away from the arc de triomphe, champs elysses, metro, and the airfrance airport shuttle to CDG or Orly. The staff was really knowledgeable and gave good recos for restaurants (our 2 favorites are Le Hide and Chez Gabrielle which are also close by). Although the room/bathroom were clean, and the bed comfortable (and they supply L'Occitane toilettries, a plus), I am giving this place a 4 star instead of a five because the room was really small. The pictures on the site make the room look bigger than it actually is. What I did like was that we were on the lower floor so our room opened to a small patio area. Overall I would recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: TRW_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Tilsitt Etoile for 4 nights in August with my family of four, including two teenage children. We got the Quad Room. The room contained 4 single beds, a small table, desk. Overall the room was small, but had everything that we needed. It was very difficult to find a reasonably priced hotel that had a room for four people in Central Paris. We really enjoyed this hotel and it was a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the metro station. We were able to get anywhere in downtown Paris easily with a short metro ride. The breakfast room was very nice and they had a good breakfast buffet each morning with breads, meat, cereal and fruit. The hotel and rooms were very clean and we found the staff to be helpful. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is superb. Short walking distance form the arc of triumph, the champs elysees and RER/Metro station. The hotel is very nice, our room was comfortable and clean, the hotel staff is delightful and speaks English. We found their recommendations, especially about good restaurants, to be very helpful. The breakfast is quite good. In summary very good and relatively in expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice break at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryrose40
Reviews.Content: Spent our ruby wedding in Paris at this lovely hotel-the level of cleanliness is first class and the breakfast each morning was something to look forward to. Everyone friendly and helpful. The room was a bit small and the toilet very small in ou room though it had all that was necessary including nice toiletries. The front rooms unless you are at the top are very noisy -we would however stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: twoteapots
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on a city break. Ideal location, very clean, great staff and a very good price for such a central location. We were given a ground floor room which had it's own courtyard with table and chairs, which was a great bonus (they have 2 rooms with this). Have travelled a lot and this hotel rates high.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: H C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed from 08/08/11 - 11/08/11. Delightful hotel within easy reach of Arc de Triomphe and of course Les Cars Rouges (red bus) a must for popping on and off around the city. The staff are very polite and make your stay welcoming. Our twin room was better than we expected as we had read the "small room" comments beforehand, but we thought the room adequate with ensuite. A bonus to have toiletries given the price of the trip. Perfect for visiting the city and would definitely recommend it and would book again if we should return. A big thanks to all the staff at the hotel for their friendliness. The restaurant at the end of Rue Brey is also great. Pancakes are a MUST!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CMW76
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the hotel, and it was a pretty good experience. Rooms weren't too small, as is the complaint with many Paris hotels. It was quite comfortable for two people (Double Room with one double bed). Design of the rooms was simple but very cozy, and it was good to go back and relax there in the evening after a long day of walking around and sightseeing in the summer heat. Beds were very comfortable. If you want to stay around the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees area , this is a very convenient location. It is on a quiet street, just a short walk away from those spots. And a short walk from the Charles de Gaulle metro station. Staff at the front desk was friendly, especially Charles, who works the overnight shift. And the cleaning crew does a great job, as I was very happy with how clean the hotel was. Enjoyed the breakfast too. The only thing I would like to see more of is a better level of knowledge about the restaurants in the neighborhood. But it was no big deal, as the positives far outweighed the negatives during our stay. Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: missf1017
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, 7/16/11 - 7/19/11, and it was perfect for our purposes. If you want a room with air conditioning, be sure to specifically request it - we did, and the a.c. was great. The bed was super comfortable, the room was VERY CLEAN and spacious enough for the two of us, and the complimentary products in the bathroom are fantastic. Although we did not use either, the hotel has room service available 24 hours as well as a cute bar in the lobby. The desk staff are all very friendly and super helpful. For the price, it was very reasonable and more than what we expected. Be sure to sign and write a little message in the guestbook located in the lobby bar before you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Two Blocks from the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: Iggzy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice three star hotel two blocks from the Arc de Triomphe--an easy walk with luggage from the Etoile Charles de Gaulle metro station. This is a lively part of town filled with restaurants, cafes and brasseries. Two blocks away is a nice market with every food imaginable for sale. It was nice to be able to climb the Arc de Triomphe at night and see the lights of Paris. We had a first floor triple room which was large and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experiene”
Reviews.Author: hoffmansbck
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely hotel during a week's visit to Paris. The staff was knowledgeable about the surrounding area and happy to offer suggestions or assistance. The rooms are small but well appointed and very clean. The location of the hotel is extremely convenient with major sites and metros nearby. The breakfast was delicious with friendly service and an easy way to start the day. We will look forward to staying here again and will recommend the hotel to friends and family. When making reservations ask for an upper room in order to have a view of the rooftops and be away from possible street noise. Thank you for a lovely visit. Cathleen and Kendahl Hoffman

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tmu201
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend and were pleasantly surprised. It's a very cute boutique hotel with great service. The location is superb-right next to the Arc and metro. My only complaints are that the rooms are small (typical of Paris hotels though) and the bed wasn't a double. It was two singles put together. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vale_izzo
Reviews.Content: My stay at Tivoli hotel was great. Rooms are little but lovely decorated. Everything is new and really fancy. Also, very clean and well located. Personnel were really kind and made me feel at home. Pictures at the web page reflects how the hotel it is. The only thing that I'd improve is related to noises. I could hear every noise coming from the lobby (when the cleaning lady started to work early in the morning) and also my neighbours noises when they left and came to their room.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay in a friendly well appointed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Outtheoffice
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Tilsitt Etolie booked via Cresta holidays using Eurostar. There were 5 in our party, including three teenagers. The whole experience was first rate, the trains were on time both ways, the hotel easy to find from the Gare Du Nord; a short metro journey. Before we left we had emailed the hotel to see if they could recommend a nearby restaurant for the first night which they did and they also booked it for us. Le Hide was a full on french dinning experience which meant very creamy and rich, the reception staff were reluctant to recommend anywhere else in the area but there are a number of good restaurants within walking distance, all seemed fine to us, especially an Italian in the same road. But they are Paris prices so beware. The hotel was clean, the kids shared a family room which was a very good size, our double room was a little on the small size. Both rooms were spotlessly clean, somewhat hot but there is a very quiet air conditioning unit in the rooms which we left on all night. The hotel was quiet at night, its main clientel seemed to be single business travellers only woken once by a passing dustcart. The hotel is situated on a very quiet side street. Breakfast was also good with a wide selection of fruit, bread, crossaints, and cooked meats. Our only slight negative was the fact the hotel is on the western side of the city so we always seemed to be travelling east to the main sites, although the Arch de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee are right on the doorstep. Well recommended and we will certainly return when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaNeath
Reviews.Content: We visit Paris annually and usually stay at hotels with a similar star rating. This is by far the best so far. The reception staff were excellent, particularly the young gentleman working on Sunday 24th October. The hotel is clean and comfortable and I must say the pillows were the best I have ever slept on in a Paris hotel! The breakfast was generous with plenty of choice in a lovely setting. The lift was rather small but no smaller than those in many other hotels we have stayed at in Paris. If you want a large, impersonal, flashy hotel then this is not the place for you. It's small, friendly, clean and comfortable. The only drawback is that there is a shortage of good quality restaurants in the near vicinity, but this is no fault of the hotel. The young gentleman on reception booked us into a lovely restaurant on the Sunday evening when the booking I had made for a local restaurant did not materialize (the restaurant I had booked the meal at was closed). Through his recommendation we had a wonderful last evening in Paris. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good position and service”
Reviews.Author: mihpre
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for 3 nights in October, with a colleague. We were supposed to stay in another hotel, close to our company's office, but that was fully booked. That was good luck, for we got a booking in this nice hotel. It's a small hotel, very clean, the personnel is really friendly and helpful, breakfast was good. The position it's also very good, 2 min to Arch of Triumph by walk, close to Charles de Gaulle - Étoile metro/RER station and Champs Elysees. If you want to visit Paris and want a nice place to stay, choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you booked a superior room make sure it is.”
Reviews.Author: travelfanatic060
Reviews.Content: We had a confirmed booking for a superior room. After arriving Manual booked as in and was very helpful with Paris information. At first I found it strange that our room had a terrace and not a balcony as informed by Gaelle. Paging trough my file that night I realised that we were booked in a double room without any explanation and offer for the reduced Sunday rate and Monday rate. The next morning Jean confirmed that we were booked in a double room and he would confirm with the duty manager to adjust our account to the double rate. The duty manager then explaination that other guest had extended their stay therefore the rooms were not available. Only then the rate was adjusted. The first night we had a good night chocolate, not the second. Just a general note : when travelling in France keep all your possessions locked in safes or your luggage even maps and chocolates

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: scotsontourz
Reviews.Content: Really nice and friendly staff, speedy check in. Good location. Rooms small but very clean and nicely presented. Great shower. Breakfast simple but good. No view from windows but was there for business anyway. Hairdryers... attached to the wall but cord way too short - a small issue... Would recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I would stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: joe_MN_USA
Reviews.Content: First of all this was my first trip to Paris. I speak no French and I had about 24 hours to spend at the hotel before moving to a sales meeting. I came into the hotel at 7:30am and they moved my reservation to get me into a room right away. After check in I was given a map and the front desk person helped me figure how I could see everything I could see in the 24 hours I had to tour Paris. It was great! The room was small but clean and very nice. The breakfast was great. Now I have a taxi pick me up in the morning and he can't find our office on his GPS. The front desk stopped everything they were dong and got me another Taxi, called my office and specific directions to the office. I am 50 years old and in all my travels I have never seen such great customer service. I only wish i could remember their names so I could praise them in person!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Abhishek_Saha
Reviews.Content: The biggest advantage of this hotel is its location. Its walking distance from the Arc de Triomphe, making it very convenient to use all modes of transport e.g. metro, hop on hop off buses as well as Air France buses for airport transfers. Champ Elysses is just around the corner. The hotel breakfast is expensive @ 15 euros per person. There are many eatery options near the Arc. The rooms are average, and the size of bathroom is very small to the extent of being claustrophobic. On the plus side, our room had a mini courtyard at the rear.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and great location”
Reviews.Author: bakery
Reviews.Content: The location and price of this hotel made it a real winner. We stayed here for one night after a trip through Normandy, and it was quiet and convenient. Being so close to the peripheral road, it was perfectly located for an early morning flight home. The quad room is an excellent deal for families.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: Coldothegreat
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, rooms were of a good size and the one we stayed in had a balcony overlooking the street, perfect for a nice glass of wine or 3. We stayed there for 2 nights and the room was so quiet we didn't hear anyone else there. We stayed here on recommendation from my mother and she wasn't wrong. If I return to Paris I would deffinately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The sweetest hotel”
Reviews.Author: SushieG
Reviews.Content: Paris-sized rooms, not huge, but definitely enough spac for 2 comfortably. It was so well decorated with lovely wallpaper, art and gorgeous furniture that I really didn't notice the size. Plus, 2 balconies, yay! There was not a lot of outside noise, but we did hear our upstairs neighbour a lot, although certainly not enough to keep someone up at night. Room and bathroom were well equipped with modern fittings, including air con. Bathroom bench was sprinkled with rose petals :) No in-room tea/coffee making facilities so you can have this sent up to your room (no charge) in a beautiful tea set. Wifi was good. Staff were lovely and helpful - with the exception of one receptionist who was weird and awkward, but not unfriendly. Breakfast was god, although not great. Location 2 mins from Arc de Triopmhe is awesome. 3 metros nearby, and obviously a million cafes, restaurants and patisseries around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Janakat
Reviews.Content: Best location ever 2 minutes from arc de triumph, walking distance for champ Lyese Street Just in the middle of everything 8 Euros away from Eifel tower unless you want to walk (we walked the first day) Although there is no view from the rooms Seriously consider this hotel when you visit Paris and you won’t be disappointed at all

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel near L'Arc de triomphe”
Reviews.Author: JiminVA
Reviews.Content: Great location two blocks from L'Arc de Triomphe and a block from the Air France airport bus stop. Good size room and bath by Paris standards, well-kept, good minibar and room service, and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “unparalleled customer service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: 1time_reviewer
Reviews.Content: i spent over 2 months traveling throughout europe and in countless hotels, and the Hotel Tilsitt Etoile had the best customer service by far. the staff was friendly and welcoming, and were very eagar to make sure i had the best time possible in paris by making suggestions on where to go out and what to see based on my personal preferences. i can't say enough about their staff...not to mention the location is a convenient bus ride from the airport and right at the end of champs elysees near the arc de triumph.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy one!”
Reviews.Author: miracle21
Reviews.Content: Located just a short walk from Ternes station and a stone's throw away from Arc Du Triomphe and Champ Elysees...we could not ask for more. Cosy room, comfy beds...warm service from the desk...the elevator was creepy though, it creaked at certain levels (was kinda worried I'd get trapped inside!) Never thought Paris could offer such an affordable lil gem (the last night went at 1 euro!) Oh yes, a really affordable eatery near the hotel, 4 course that goes for 11,70 euro!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: niedler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Tilsitt and found it to be a quiet, clean and affordable. Go to "Yuppies" to eat, about a 100 feet away. A 2 minute walk gets you to a great farmers market type setup. Ask front desk where the nearest "Paul" Pastry Shop is located and it is just around the corner. I think it is open most mornings after 9:00AM.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: m3manohar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel last week (late March/early April) and we really enjoyed our stay. The front staff, especially Manuel, were very, very helpful. The hotel is in a fantastic location (two short blocks from the Arc d' Triomphe) and just two streets off the Champs Elysee Blvd. The rooms are small but comfortable. Continental breakfast is available daily in the dining room. There was a variety of dishes including croissants, different types of baguettes, variety of cheeses, yogurts, cereal, juices and boiled eggs. There is complimentary Internet available in the lobby. They also serve variety of coffees and other drinks in the lobby. The lobby is quiet and is a great place to unwind. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay at a clean, reasonably priced hotel located in a fantastic part of town. By the way, the metro station is two short blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, warm and welcoming staff and an ideal location- highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jadew_7
Reviews.Content: My two girlifriends and myself spent 3 nights in this hotel to celebrate my 21st birthday in Paris. The first thing I noticed about this hotel was the ideal location. It was 5 minute walk to the the Champs Elyees where theres a Metro station and numerous shops restaurants and typical french cafes. Checking in / out was very simple and all members of staff were incredibly helpful and willing to do whatever they could to ensure you had an enjoyable stay. Whilst I was there the staff willingly made us reservations at restaurants, ordered us taxis, helped us with directions and recommended places for us to go. Also, as it was my 21st, my parents contacted the hotel to organise a surprise bottle of champagne to be sent to my room. The hotel made this really easy for my parents to organise and went to the trouble of trying to find out my plans for the day so that they new the perfect time to bring up the champagne. The staff definately went that extra step to connect with those staying with them on a personal level, and undoubtedly contributed to making my trip memorable. To follow, being three 20/21 year old girls, we were hoping for a spacious room to get ready in everyday and not to be on top of eachother. Our room in this hotel catered for this exact need. We had three single beds which a large floor space in the centre, a table, three chairs, a large wardobe, a desk, bedside lamps and tables and a flat screen TV. We then had a large bathroom with a powerful shower and a seperate toilet room. Our room was beautifully decorated and one thing I noticed straight away was how clean it was. The maids cleaned the rooms everyday and provided us each with clean towels each day. The hotel was small and quiet, which we found to be ideal when having a tiring day out exploring the sites of Paris. There was a computer in reception with internet which all guests were welcome to use free of charge at their leisure. There was also a bar which, although we didnt use, looked to have a wide variety or drinks available. Although we didnt have breaksfast during our stay at the hotel, the breakfast room was located downstairs and looked very spacious and well docorated in line with the overall theme of the hotel. Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel for all types of guests as the staff really do do whatever they can to cater to your needs. It was incredibly warm and welcoming and all three of us had a fantastic time there. A very memorable stay. Jade, (Oxford)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Franbrasilia
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small, but was very close to Champs Elysees - 5 minute walk. The street of the hotel was in bad shape and there was almost no sidewalk. The room was clean, beds confortable, great amenities. It was refurbished (I don't know if this is the word for it...). For the price, I expected more, but it's Paris we are talking about. The recepcionist, Mano, was very helpfull and gave great sugestions too.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, our home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nilgunemremtraveler
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent staff, nicely decorated rooms, While reserving your room in advance always have advise from the hotel directly. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful for all your needs. Has ideal location on a quite street right in the heart of Paris, few minutes away from Arc de Triomphe. Rooms are cosy, warm decoration, you feel at home. Within three months I stayed in the same hotel and will not look for another in Paris. Already missed being there.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, image, location & value”
Reviews.Author: Jazziat
Reviews.Content: Well, I have been there last year in January in a business trip, actually i was impressed in what regards location & service.....stuff are very friendly spceially one of them who used to tell me everything to do .... gave me directions & he was very kind to give me notes about places to visit as it was my first time in Frace .... i`m sorry i don`t remember his name ... very good breakfast .... nice rooms .... very good free internet connection,...which was very important to me .... near to everything specially RER .... If you want to enjoy, and to pay acceptable cost ... go there

Reviews.Title: “excellent services”
Reviews.Author: nachotierno
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with my colleague and i think is a very good hotel. Excellent location (close to champs elisse and a lot of public transport office). Also the breakfast is good, the room are very clean and Manuel can organize everything you need and more. Reallly worth it. The only thing that has to be improved is the Wi-Fi connection. Sometimes does not work well.

Reviews.Title: “A little overrated”
Reviews.Author: tripleff
Reviews.Content: The location was great, but the room was quite small. What turned me off was the pair of dirty underwear that was beside one of the beds on the floor. I kicked it under the bed. It's probably still there (room #24). For the price, I don't think it deserves it's high Trip Advisor Rating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: needman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Tislitt Etoile and had a wonderful time! Manuel was so incredibly helpful - as I only had one night / day in Paris and wasn't sure what was the best way to spend my time there. He helped me organise a boat trip down the Seine and told me about a wonderful little market right near the hotel. The hotel was really lovely, beautiful bedroom, bathroom, and reception area. I didn't get to taste the breakfast, but the room looked great - so next time I'm there I will certainly partake!!!! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants somewhere away from the hustle and bustle, but near enough to get to it all! Thanks again Manuel!

Reviews.Title: “A GEM!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morenachica
Reviews.Content: This place is really a hidden gem. It' s more of a boutique hotel if you ask me. Nicely decorated and not as standard as some hotels. The location was perfect since we came in on ryanair and took the bus into Paris and the drop-off location was about a 15 min walk. I first must say the staff is very friendly and helpful! The place was SPOTLESS and VERY CLEAN! We stayed in the room with the 2 twin beds, its a tight fit but very cozy and nicely decoarated. LOCATION LOCATION. This hotel is close to the Metro and restaurants, cafes, and pubs without all the noise and our room was on the street and we didnt hear anything.. I definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, excellent value hotel just off Champs Elysee”
Reviews.Author: Mikinblack
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, within 10 mins walk of Arc de Triumphe and close to several Metro stops. Friendly, knowledgeable front desk staff. Rooms are OK size but bathroom was quite small. My 2nd floor room had good air con but it also had two large windows which opened onto a small balcony above Rue Brey. This seems to be a quiet street (despite what looks like a "nightclub" (Club Venus!) almost directly opposite). There was no street noise when I stayed (midweek). Free wi-fi was very welcome. There were no problems with facilities except the combination of a smallish shower screen and powerful shower (which was lovely) caused a minor flood on bathroom floor. Breakfast was in basement and was excellent (buffet style - didn't see evidence of a cooked option - but plenty of fresh french bread, freshly squeezed orange juice and croissants). I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “too good to tell other people about”
Reviews.Author: cjweir
Reviews.Content: A second visit was even better than the first. Staff were as always extremely helpful and offered useful advice on where to visit and how to get there. Large room on first floor was great for a family of four with young kids who loved the breakfast. Service was great in the restaurant friendly and efficient. Great location near CG Etoile and a good fruit market nearby and a small supermarket too. Intersting crepe place just over the road which the kids loved and a pizzeria round the corner and good bar up the road to the Arc. lots of choices to eat in the neighbourhood for families and small kids. Quiet and clean. Difficult to fault it especially having stayed in so many inferior and more expensive hotels around the world. We will definitely go back next year

Reviews.Title: “Another brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Beekite
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, for our second time, this year and were not disappointed to have returned. As before the staff were lovely, very friendly and go out of their way to assist when they can. The location is fantastic, right by many tourist venues and easy access to all facilities. The hotel is great, although our room was a little tired looking this year it was still clean and very suitable for our needs. We arrived very early (10.30) but our room was ready and checking in was no issue. My French is poor but I had a go and the staff were thankfully much more able with their English! We would definitely return again to this hotel and have recommended it to friends, family and colleagues. The support did not stop even after we left the hotel as Manuel was happy to deal with my telephone call from the bus to check what terminal I needed at the airport. Service like this is hard to find and when you do you should tell everyone! Thanks to all the staff especially Fanny and Manuel for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION AND VERY HELPFUL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: CLE6
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Manual at the front desk was very helpful, free internet was great and the location is perfect...just a few minuted from Champs Elysees and the metro to take you wherever you need to go. We had a room with a street view and it was clean and had everything we needed. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Manuel at reception could even get Bridget Jones organised!”
Reviews.Author: lizzyWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at this Hotel and Manuel on reception was so helpful! He said B. Jones was his favourite film hence the comment. All of the staff were very pleasant, including the usually unsung room staff. We had asked for a quiet room and were given a room on the top (6th.) floor which wasn't a problem as there was a lift but may have been a bit smaller accordingly. Nice little en-suite with good reliable shower. Comfortable bed. Buffet breakfast was adequate but a bit pricey (E13) for the choice available but probably would have paid as much at a cafe. Only approx. 5minute walk from Charles De Gaulle/Etoile Metro and the Arc De Triomphe. Plenty of restaurants in the vicinity. Happy with our stay and especially the help and advice given by Manuel. To us it seems a little expensive for what you get but I think that's just Paris/capital cities generally and not a reflection on the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: spiffmiff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in July with a friend on a quick visit to Paris. I'll qualify this review saying I haven't had too much experience with other accommodation in Paris so its a ittle hard to judge value-for-money, however it seemed to be a really good price for what we got. We had a lovely twin room overlooking the street, with large double windows. The staff are wonderful and very helpful. Fluent in English which was a great bonus for us. Free internet was fantastic. Location close (5min walk) to two metro stations (Charles De Gaulle Etoile and Ternes), and the Arc De Triomphe. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, very clean and spacious with a very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: KeepTravelinUtah
Reviews.Content: The Tilsitt is one of the few hotels to offer family rooms in Paris at a reasonable price. The room was spacious for four adult family members with 4 twin beds. The street is quite with only a five minute walk to the Metro, Champs de Elysees and the Arc de Triomphe.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for both confort and location with such a pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: abaron
Reviews.Content: I often travel to Paris for short business trips. Hotel tilsitt Etoile has now become my second home! The staff is so welcoming and rooms so confortable that I feel at home. Clean, quiet and ideally located, 5 minutes from the Champs Elysees! I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Manuel is the best concierge ever”
Reviews.Author: nobexx
Reviews.Content: Second time in Paris with my two sisters. The location of the Tilsitt Etoile is perfect. Five minutes to the MEtro, Champs Elysees, and the Arc. Our room was spacious--even by American standards. Manuel, at the front desk went above and beyond in helping us. Even called to make sure that what we wanted to see was opened on the national holiday. Real coffee in our room every morning. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodation in heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: denismca
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous reviews and we weren't disappointed. It is very close to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees but is on a quiet street. The hotel is kept spotless and there is free wi-fi available throughout. the rooms are smallish but adequate. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a great place”
Reviews.Author: ceders
Reviews.Content: I am travelling quite a lot in Europe and Asia. Hotel Tilsitt definitely stands out of the crowd by the quality of the place. Area is central, accomodation is just great (especially with the recent renovation), and above all people are nice and helpful. This place is not a big hotel, it is just a high quality, affordable (family owned) hotel that feels like home. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Simushga
Reviews.Content: first of all the location is great, it is near "arc du triumphe" (one of paris attractions) and "champs elysees" (that you can walk and enjoy the environment, shops, cafes,...), and also the nearest subway station is "charge de gaulle etoile" (about 100 meter from the hotel) and four metro lines pass this station and one can go directly to many famous destinations in Paris from this station... the second thing that I experienced during my visit was the kind and helpful reception of the hotel, they helped me with every question I had, from reserving an RER to barcelona to finding a nearby bookstore... the third thing is the room, it is quite comfortable, clean and quiet, ours was number 16 and it had both bath tub and shower, and they offered us free wireless internet in our room to use with my own laptop... the only negative things that might be seen is that: the lobby is not so large, and the place dedicated to taking shower is not big, but I think considering all positive factors about this hotel like the great location and helpful receptions, these can be ignored...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a first time visit”
Reviews.Author: TravelRocksOC
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect location for our first visit to Paris. It was walking distance from the l'arc de triomphe and the Champs Elysees and the Metro. The staff was very helpful from the housekeeper to the front desk attendance. The breakfast had a nice variety of food and the breakfast room had a very nice atmosphere. Thank you Manuel especially for your guidance and help with everything.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel Near L'Arc De Triomphe!”
Reviews.Author: Nullisecondus
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay - great staff - friendly and very helpful for making the time pleasant! Boutique hotel located less than 2-blocks from L'Arc De Triomphe and Champs Elysee - yet tucked away and incredibly quiet. Beautiful interior and rooms; nicely modern - a bit small - but very stylish - hardwood floors and full size bathrooms with tub - quite a nice treat. Highly recommend for quality, value and location! Now my default place to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: EssexUKCouple
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, tucked away but in a great location. We always stay here when visiting Paris, only once did we stay in a 5star hotel but came back to the Tilsitt the following year. We have always found the staff really helpful, and during this stay Manuel was really great, going to great lengths to get us a reservation on a dinner cruise. The rooms are quite small, so dont expect too much but they are clean and well maintained. We had a problem with the air conditioning unit and when we reported it we were assured it would be repaired that day. True to their word it was fully functioning when we got back from dinner. Will always return to this hotel, its just around the corner from the Arc de Triomph and Ave des Champs-Elysees - superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: elliottaz
Reviews.Content: Spent five night here last week and had a good time. A solid 3-star hotel, very close to numerous restaurants and most importantly, a central hub metro/RER station and to the Arc de triomphe. Reception staff are very attentive and helpful and are very willing and happy to answer any question. We chose the Superior Room, since it was larger than the standard and we found it to be quite comfortable. We chose not to partake in the breakfast that was served as it was very expensive (13 euros per person, per day) - so I just walked 3 minutes to a boulangerie and bought bread and pastries, which were wonderful. There are a couple of supermarkets nearby, which open at about 9am and close at 9pm - which can be quite annoying to those who are used to 24 hour convenience. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a cost-effective, convenient, comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Finally i found hotel in Paris , Clean , quite , warm , friendly stuff & location”
Reviews.Author: ericIsrael
Reviews.Content: value for money 200% simple, so clean & warm , off champ elisee but so close highly recomanded Eyal

Reviews.Title: “Very quirky hotel - You really feel at home so close to the Champs Elysees!”
Reviews.Author: ge4567
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Tilsitt Etoile a few days ago. The staff is very welcoming, and the design so warm that you almost feel at home. This hotel is very confortable, and ideally located : 5 minutes walk from the Champs Elysees, 15 minutes to tjhe Tour Eiffel, and 15 minutes from Gare du Nord Eurostar station! Perfect place for a stay in Paris. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: perezpadron
Reviews.Content: I am writing to express my gratitude for the service received during my visit to Paris in March. I would like to highlight who was the provider of all the care, Manuel. He was simply outstanding from the day I arrived until the day I left, because of him I am going to book again my next regular conference weekend in June. Finally I strongly recommend everyone to contact Manuel to organize your visit to Paris staying at the superb Tilsitt Etoile Hotel. Dr. Perez-Padron PhD

Reviews.Title: “I couldnt believe that it is so good!!”
Reviews.Author: Rita_Tenreiro
Reviews.Content: i choose this hotel based on the comments on the trip adviser. i read so many good things about it. in one word: amaizing upon arrival manuel was outstanding, i didn t expect such a friendly welcoming...normally we never expect a smile from a french staff...but here it was something completly different from paris hotels usual service. the location is perfect, we could move very easy to the city. next to the hotel there is plenty of good restaurants and bars. the rooms are very good and clean. one of the main plus is the free of charge internet and they also have a computer in the lobby for those who doesnt like to travel with the laptop...like me.... i do recomend this hotel and i look foward to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant gem of a hotel. Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Joy-Singapore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tilsitt for 5 nights and loved it. We flew in from Singapore and took the Air France bus to the hotel. It was a short (4 minutes or thereabouts) walk to the hotel from the Air France bus stop. The Tilsitt's location is ace - near to the Charles de Gaulle main station and the Ternes station, so you get a choice of various different metro lines. There is also a Monoprix round the corner where you can get groceries (water, chocolates, sandwiches etc) so that's very convenient. There are a lot of good food and decent cafes in the vicinity. The hotel is a couple of minutes' walk to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs and my husband and I had after-dinner strolls along the Champs. Yes, the rooms are rather small but I reckon that's quite normal for Parisienne hotels in this price bracket. Although small, the rooms are comfortable and clean. Oh, and the toiletries are lovely. The walls are thin, our room was near the lift and from time to time we could hear some sounds from the lift but nothing too distubring and nothing that kept us awake. I thought the pillows were a little to thin (flat?) for my liking but I reckon this aspect would vary from person to person. I didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that. The hotel smells lovely. Manuel keeps the place wonderfully charming with nice scented candles (these are unique, good-quality Tilsitt Hotel candles and you should consider getting one of them, I bought 4) and warm lighting in the lobby. All these make returning to the hotel after a long day out a very welcome and pleasant experience - kinda like stumbling home to a warm, cosy and nice-smelling living room after a tiring day out. The staff in the hotel are very nice. Manuel particularly is brilliant - very helpful and always smiling. We had a very nice chat about candles and other scented stuff we love and I realised he had stayed past his working hours (about 45 minutes past) to chat with me and introduce me to some lovely French-made candles. I think that speaks volumes about the people at this hotel and the lengths they will go to to make their guests feel at home. It was my fourth time to Paris and the Tilsitt is by far the best hotel I've stayed in. My husband and I will definitely stay at the Tilsitt if we are back in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel, The Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: derrmia
Reviews.Content: I Booked This Hotel as it was well reviewed on Trip Advisor and It Lived up to all my expectations and more... Its a Lovely Cosy Hotel with Very Easy Access to every Attraction... the Staff were very FRIENDLY and Spoke English ,, they Made us Feel so so Welcome and Even Gave us a Going Away Gift .. Our Rooms were so nice with windows overlooking a Quiet Street just Perfect.. i am Already planning My next trip Back to this Fab Hotel in the Centre Of Paris thanks to Manuel for everything

Reviews.Title: “returned my purse...thank you!”
Reviews.Author: areno
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the staff, but especially for the ones responsible for finding and returning items we left behind in a hurry...We will absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Toshibone
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights from 29th to 31st,2008 and checked out on January 1st 2009. We had a very good time there. First of all, the location is great, almost 3 minutes walking distance from Arc of Triumph, Metro station and many restaurants. No transit to Lovure Museum by Metro. Very convenient location. 2nd of all, the staff was superb! Emanuel is a great guy who gave us a lot of information for sight-seeing in Paris, which as a result, save our times a lot! He can speak perfect English. Also other staff we talked in the night was great, too. Unfortunately, the ladies working at restaurant could not speak English at all, so we had a small trouble there. Also the walls are thin, so we can hear people talking in the next room. But over all, the impression was wonderful. We really spent a valuable time in Paris with Tilsitt Etoile hotel. Thanks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleAndChuck
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris for three days at the start of our European tour. We came across this hotel by reading reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to book. Boy were we happy we did! We absolutely loved this place. The rooms were very 'Parisian,' giving us the true European experience. The room was clean and the staff was great. We even had a tiny balcony where we could view the streets of Paris early in the morning while having our coffee. The location could not have been better. We could walk within minutes to the Champs Elysees, we could see the Eiffel Tower and Arc d'Triomphe as we walked back to our hotel each night, and we could access the metro by foot within minutes. Above all, we were extremely pleased with the friendliness of the staff. Particularly, Manuel. He was extremely helpful during the length of our stay. He helped us find our way around, and he helped get us back to the airport on the day we were to depart. And he did it all with a smile on his face, seeming genuinely happy to help :) I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone - great price for the location and convenience, and the place is great!

Reviews.Title: “Everything made easy”
Reviews.Author: Donkers19
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location, the staff are superb and helpful, and everything is made easy for you. Location is good with restaurants and bars on the doorstep. Even DJ recommendations if you need them!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and wish I could've stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: dairycallou
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was lovely from the moment we arrived. It was located within walking distance of many shops and restaurants, on a quiet but lively street which our room overlooked. The lobby bar was warm and inviting and adjacent was a garden patio with stairwells up to the rooms. There were lifts to the rooms as well which we used when bringing in our luggage. Our room was immaculate and beautifully decorated with red duvets and curtains, and I loved the deep bathtub and rose petals on the bathroom sink as well the chocolates on the pillows. We had to leave early the next day on a train to London and regrettably didn't get to enjoy the breakfast, but everything else about the stay exceeded our expectations. The staff could not have been warmer. I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to return for a longer stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tilsitt Etoile- Our Place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ptelesco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Tilsitt recently. We had heard a good report about this hotel from a business acquaintance of mine and made our choice solely from that recommendation. We were quite comfortable in our ground floor room. I think ours was one of the smaller rooms in the hotel, and at times we felt a little cramped. But it was clean and comfortable and had doors that opened onto our own private patio area. One of my favorite things during our stay was the room service. On several occasions, we called to have coffee brought to our room. Within just a few minutes, there would be a soft knock on the door and one of the staff would have a tray of probably the best coffee we had during our stay in Paris. Not only that, but they heated the milk so that it wouldn't cool our coffee down when we mixed it. That kind of attention to detail was one of the reasons we liked this hotel so well. All of the staff was so very friendly and helpful and gave us a personalized attention that we were definitely not used to from our travels elsewhere. We are especially thankful to Manuel at the front desk. He always took whatever time or effort that was necessary to help us get around. Whether helping with our French, explaining the Metro, recommending a restaurant or just giving us some excellent tips and direction. Our trip was immeasurably enhanced by his professional attitude and his sincere friendliness and desire to assist us. We hope to visit Paris again one day and we would definitely come back to the Tilsitt. Paul & Donna Telesco

Reviews.Title: “Tilsitt - like everyting in Paris, a little expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: asearchforreason
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed in Paris once before at the Hotel Valadon, which I found to be superior to the Tilsitt Etoile. The reception at the Tilsitt Etoile was generally very helpful, but we found the rooms to be a bit small and dingy. The internet here was free which is a nice bonus for Europe. The breakfast in the basement was fine, but was not included in the room price. I think Valadon's location was better as well. It is located in an interesting area of Paris with a market street (Rue Cler) one block away. The Tilsitt is located near the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysees, which is nice if those are your main interests. It also means the area is fairly busy with tourists which can be annoying. If you head north from the hotel instead, you will find some respite from the crowds and there are some good restaurants around. Overall, I was not particularly impressed with the Tilsitt and would try to stay at Hotel Valadon if I returned to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for that weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AnitaB2008
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a lovely weekend in Paris with my 7 year old son. I booked the Tilsett after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and can say they are 100% accurate. The hotel was in a good location and close to the metro for when we had to travel further afield. Our room was huge by Paris standards and clean with attractive, neutral furnishings. I really appreciated the attention to detail that separates this hotel from others with the same rating. They knew my son was coming so as well the chocolate on our pillows, my son also had a lollipop on his. This is the sort of service i would expect from a 5* establishment so was really chuffed. The Tilsett serves breakfast til 10am but I notice a few stragglers coming down to breakfast after that and they were catered for. Breakfast is a buffet continental fare and everything was fresh. You can also order room service if you'd prefer. The only thing I would say is that I am a light sleeper and our room was close to the lift so this provided a slightly disturbed night sleep. However this did not interfere with my stay and I would definitely book this hotel again. Manuel who runs the desk is simply excellent. He is warm, friendly and extremely helpful. I thoroughly recommend this hotel and I will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and service”
Reviews.Author: EileenSeah
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on my own after reading the reviews in Trip Advisor. I must say the reviews are very helpful and accurate. Hotel Tilsitt is in a great location. Every morning I just walked out for a good cup of expresso as there are cafes close by and there you will immediately see the Arc de Triompe (whether I turned right or left of the little street - Rue Brey where the hotel is situated, you cant miss the Arc!) Soon after, the Arc and Mc Mahon street became the "landmark" and useful street direction for taxi drivers and even for myself when I walked back to the hotel. The service is personal and great especially at the front desk, they are helpful, sincere and earnest. The housekeeping too, took the initiative to repair the the wash-basin (water was not flowing down properly so i took out the stopper and I did not say anything.) They even informed me when the plumber will be coming and then checked after that if all was well. Overall, I grew attached to the hotel, as the room may be small but cosy. Thanks for making my stay pleasant and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: LisaTLondon
Reviews.Content: My husband has been using this hotel regulalry for business trips for over a year now and always enjoys his stay, so when we booked a weekend in Paris it was the obvious choice. We had room 76, which is a lovely double room on the ground floor with French doors leading to its own private patio garden, which was very pretty! The location is fantastic - very central for sightseeing and for shopping and the staff are consistently friendly and helpful. They have free wifi which is great for business travelers (and for checking out the shortest route to the shopping centres!), and there are a number of good pubs/cafes within walking distance. My husband will continue to use the Tilsitt for business and I'd be happy to stay there again for a weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tilsitt - Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Vikki11
Reviews.Content: I have used Hotel Tilsitt regularly for the last 18 months. My stays have been for both business and pleasure and I have always received a fantastic service (especially from Manuel). The hotel is clean, friendly and the staff always aim to please. I would recommend Hotel Tilsitt to anyone - location is fantastic if you wish to be central for site-seeing purposes!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely typical Paris atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMaurik
Reviews.Content: Looked for a hotel to stay in Paris after a couple of day's in Disney. Hotel desk was very friendly and spook fluently English. Gave a clear discription how to get to the hotel. The hotel itself is located in Rue Brey which is a narrow street near the Champs Elysee and is build in a typical Pars style. The rooms a not so big but very cosy and have (very important!) good beds. The breakfast is excellent! We had a very nice stay and will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: frenchfancies
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fabulous girlie weekend in beautiful Paris. The tilsitt etoile hotel was absolutley perfect, great location for exploring Paris - a stones throw from the Arc de Triomphe giving you access to open top tour buses by the dozen which I would thoroughly recommend ( ideal for getting your bearings) . The hotel rooms where small but spotless and very comfortable , the breakfast room was very nice and staff welcoming , the food itself was lovely and varied. Hotel staff where very helpful especially Jean he recommended a great authenic french restaurant which we all really enjoyed and felt it added to our whole french experience. Finally Im not really the type of person who normally would write a review on a hotel but I really do feel the Tilsitt Etoile deserves a special mention . If you are visiting Paris I would definatley recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler133333
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 5 nights during the first week of September with some friends. The room was cute and well kept and the shower was great. Our air conditioning went out one night but seemed to fix itself, which did not pose a problem. The location is good and easily accessible to the Arc, the metro and the Eiffel Tower is about a 20 minute walk. A lot of the reviews I read complimented the staff. I thought the staff was less than friendly. In fact, a few of the desk people seemed bothered when we asked for information. On the day we left, the desk person was arguing with the shuttle driver in front of us, and muttered some rude comments to us,in French, because he arrived 20 minutes prior to our scheduled pick up time and did not want to wait for us. The internet service was not working the first day or so we were there. Prior to arrival, I had emailed twice regarding shuttle service from CDG to the hotel and no one ever got back to me as well as I had sent an email asking about currency exchange at the hotel and no one ever got back to me. I would give the staff a rating of 5 out of 10 just becuase I did not think they were polite, friendly or helpful. Jean was by far the friendliest (he's a student and works parttime and there is one heavyset lady who was there on the day we checked in (and got a room prepared for us quickly upon morning arrival) and left who was friendly. All of the others, were not. I would stay here again just because it was a clean hotel with comfortable bedding and a good shower and a good location. I would not stay based upon the staff.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SJK516
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel this past May while in Paris. Not knowing the city at all made it difficult to select a hotel but this turned out to be a great find. The room we had was very large, with a king size bed !!!, and faced into a small courtyard area which made it very quiet for late morning sleeping. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and assisted us with restaurants, directions and transporation. The location is just a few short blocks to the Arc and there were plenty of places to eat along the way. if you don't need a full service (with restaurant) hotel, this is a great place to stay. We will definitely stay there again the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: davidh709
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tilsitt Etoile for our visit in Paris in Aug. 2008. Initially, we had a problem with some outdoor noise in the room we stayed at located on the ground floor. We told the gentleman at the front desk and he gladly changed our room to a higher floor for us. We did not have any problems with noise after that. The gentleman at the front desk went out of his way to make our visit a great one, which is one reason why we're giving this hotel 5 stars. He booked our cab to the airport for us and honored all of our requests. Another lady staff member booked a Seine River boat tour for us and overall, the staff was very helpful in giving us advice, being courteous and friendly. Additionally, the location couldn't be beat-close to the Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Elysees and the CDG Etoile subway stop. If you can find the special price of 104 Euros, I would recommend this hotel if you're touring Paris and need a clean place to sleep. If you're looking for a luxury resort, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel full of charming qualities”
Reviews.Author: quirkycute
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our trip to Europe where we stayed at the Hotel Tilsitt Etoile. We had a wonderful stay at this hotel, I'm only disappointed that I did not know about this hotel on my last visit to Paris! The hotel itself is immaculate, beautifully decorated in a modern but very welcoming style. We stayed in a family room on the first floor and we had no problem with any noise. The room was a good size, definitely comfortable for a family of 4. We did not try and hotel breakfast so I cannot speak for that but I've only heard wonderful things about it. Another fantastic benefit is the location, the hotel is located within a 5 minute walk to the Champs-Elysees, L'arc de Triomphe and the Charles de Gaule - Etoile metro station which can take you conveniently to most museums and sights. Above all, what sets this hotel apart from the other hotels I've stayed in was the staff. They were incredibly knowledgeable and incredibly friendly, accommodating, and genuinely seemed to enjoy their jobs. I will second what another reviewer said in that Manuel helped to make our stay as comfortable and convenient as possible. If you are looking to stay in a comfortably affordable hotel in a great location, please consider staying at the Hotel Tilsitt Etoile, you won't be sorry! We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to all our friends who are Paris-bound!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent rooms, mixed staff”
Reviews.Author: zombyw00f
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but above average by Paris standards. We got a summer special deal, where we paid only EUR 104 a night, which was a great bargain. The location is central, but the nearest Metro requires a transfer for most of the sites. Some of the staff were excellent, helping us with reservations and making suggestions. But there was one VERY RUDE woman who refused to help us print an essential document. When we asked another member of the staff after she had left, they were more than happy to help us. Breakfast was not included, and seemed very overpriced at EUR 13. Overall, it is a good hotel if the location is convenient for you and if you can get a special rate. I would probably choose another hotel for my next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: HappyCoupleKent
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel at a competitive price on an offer through another website. Although the offer was only valid until the first night of our two night stay they gave us the offer price for our second night too! The welcome was warm and helpful, all reception staff were a credit to the Hotel and to Paris. The room was good value for money. Don't book here if you want to swing a cat, but it was clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Ideal for a city break when your room is for sleeping in! The breakfast room was clean and the modest selection was regularly replenished. The staff were courteous and didn't rush you. Breakfast was included in our deal, with eggs / bacon an optional extra at a reasonable price. The Hotel is easy to find and about 5 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. We would stay here again, and recommend it to anybody wanting to spend time in the centre of Paris. If your expectations are realistic you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Manuel at Hotel Tilsitt”
Reviews.Author: Roque-si
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tilsitt was a great hotel just steps away from the Champs Elysees. We had a ground floor room so it was a tiny bit noisy - but the service, the ambience and proximity to sites makes this a perfect choice. 2 things worth mentioning: 1) The breakfast was decadent and you feel like you're eating in a lovely loft-style restaurant 2) Manuel - he was the concierge when i was there. he is not only knowledgeable (knows paris well and speaks 5 languages!) but he is also the most polite and friendly and above all, helpful person in France! I visit Paris often and i have never met someone that is so worthy of praise. In fact, this is my first ever review of any trip or hotel - he was that good! Visit and make sure you ask for him!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FifiFolleDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel Tilsittt Paris.Excellent location.Pleasant ambience,excellent location near to Arc de Triomphe.Comfortable and very welll equipped and clean.Excellent buffet breakfast.Staff very helpful.Would strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: eboman
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel with very helpfull employees there on a perfect location. Breakfast very good. Rooms modern clean and well equiped and very comfortable. They even offered to hold the luggage on the last day so we could expand the visit. Multi-skilled language empoyees. We have never had a better Hotel in Paris. Recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antitan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tilsit Etoile for 4 nights at the end of July after getting a good deal from the hotel direct via its website. Its location is great 5 mins from the ARC De TRIOMPHE, using the Metro and getting off at Charles De Gaulle then follow the exit for Ave de Wagram - 5 mins then to the hotel. We were allocated room 76 which was on the ground floor directly opposite the reception and next to the office and luggage racks. first impressions were not good as we thought it would be very noisy. On entering the room it was quite dark and depressing looking but the upside was it had doors that led to a small courtyard with a table and chairs where you could sit and relax if you wanted to. The room had a double bed and although it wasnt a big room I wouldnt class it as tiny. The bed was excellent and so comfortable we slept soundly every night and we were not disturbed by any noise as previously anticipated. The room had lots of lamps and once these were switched on the room took on a different amosphere and looked great. the bathroom although small and compact had an excellent shower with lost of continious hot water and the towels were changed every day. We didnt have breakfast at the hotel so canott comment on this instead we opted to go out for breakfast to "Pauls" patisserie and another coffee shop in the market area 5 mins away - both were fab. The staff at the hotel were very pleasant and helpful and Manual recommended a great bistro called "Kobas" at "Le Hide" a few streets away typical parisien and it was fab!!!! Staff also organised the Paris shuttle back to the airport for us and it was prompt and delivered us in plenty of time-would definately reccommend this service it was 20 Euros each - can be booked on line prior at 18 euros via Easy Jet Website. We would definately stay at the Tilsitt Etoile again but try a different room next time - thank you to all the staff!!!!! PS - Top Tips Go for lunch at Cafe Marly at the Louvre its not as expensive as you would think - fab. Also Cafe de LHomme at the Trocadero - an extra special restaurant for romantics the food and the views are to die for as you can sit outside opp the Eiffel Tower and it lights up every hour from 10 pm - Cafe de Lhome closes at 2am.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: miaba
Reviews.Content: Wow – what a city! While we only had 2 full days to visit, Paris certainly lived up to its world class reputation and provided a memorable experience for our family. We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Tilsitt based largely on TripAdvisor reviews and found the information to be accurate. The hotel is located on a small side street within minutes walk from Arc de Triomphe located at Charles De Gaulle Etoile, a huge round-about where over 10 streets come together, including Avenue des Champs-Elysees. If you are driving, as we were, the parking on Rue Brey and Rue Troyon is free for August (if you’re fortunate enough to find an empty spot), otherwise there is a parking garage nearby on Avenue de Wagram which charges 25 euros per day. There are a couple of small supermarkets very close by for getting any amenities (including beer and wine). The rooms, including the bathrooms, are somewhat small, but are clean and the beds comfortable. Unfortunately our first night we discovered the air conditioner in the room was not working properly and the room was uncomfortably warm, but we were too exhausted to change rooms at that point so instead opened the window to get some outside air. While Rue Brey is relatively quiet, there was still enough outside noises to be a distraction and the first night was not very restful. Fortunately the next morning the hotel had an available room in which the a/c was operating properly, and to make up for the trouble and inconvenience did not charge us for breakfast that day. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful and the hotel provided a comfortable stay at a good value (3 nights for the price of two) and a convenient location from which to explore and experience this amazing city. Thank you to Manuel for his helpful directions to the airport – they were perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: centralparkhero
Reviews.Content: Great Location, good breakfast, clean room, comfy bed and good shower. What more do you need? Stayed here for 4 nights in July and found the hotel to be a great base for sight-seeing. It's a 2min walk from Les Arc and the Champs Elysee, and only 3 stops from Gare du Nord. The staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: EasternSeaboard
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is excellent. There are cafes and restaurants of all sorts nearby, as well as stores ranging from small convenience stores to larger specialty shops. There are also parks nearby. The hotel itself has a bar in the lobby with service around the clock, a restaurant, and room service. The food was excellent. There is hotel staff round the clock, and I and others staying there in my group found them very helpful and accommodating. They often went the extra mile. The luggage I had left there while gone one day was not only cheerfully stored, it was waiting for me in my room! It was a pleasure staying there. I would definitely stay there again, and would recommend the hotel to friends. There were a few minor mechanical problems (elevator, phone jack) but these were attended to by the staff as soon as they were reported. The staff on duty insisted that the elevator tech come in even though it was July 14th (Bastille Day), so that guests would not be too inconvenienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Toddsv26
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We only stayed for one night but it was perfect for us. The location can't be beat. It really is steps from the Arch de Triumph. We had a room on the 6th floor with terrific balconies. The room wasn't large but not too small either. The same is true for the bathroom. Both were very clean. The bed was especially comfortable. The checkin staff were helpful and they left us terrific macaroons. It was also a stylish place. We'd highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tilsitt - Great location”
Reviews.Author: David-Myria
Reviews.Content: Tilsitt is an excellent hotel regarding to what you pay and what you get. The hotel is just 2 minutes away from the Arc of Triamph and from Metro/RER station that leeds directly to Disney land. Also, the rooms are descent, clean while the room service very quick and good. The only flaw is the fact that the walls are thins and you may hear what happens in the next room but this can happen to hotels with 3 or 4 stars and far more exepnsive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Australia9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Tilsitt Etoile Paris is a wonderful hotel. If you are looking for a quaint, true parisian hotel then this is for you. The rooms are small but very warm and overall the hotel is a great place to stay. It is not a 5 star hotel but it is clean, welcoming, comfortable and in a great location (just down from the Arc De Triomphe and near the Champs Elysees).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tatoweb
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Friendly and helpful staff. Romantic, small and cozy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “what I expected - nothing more, nothing less”
Reviews.Author: sp_gala
Reviews.Content: Overall was a satisfactory hotel. We found the room on arrival clean and everything in order.
