The bathroom was somewhat small as was the room but definitely not a problem as we did not spend much time there. The front desk was friendly and did its job (not that I had any strange requests to put them to the test). Location is good (5 min walk to the metro). Try to get a room internally as the cars on the street could be annoying for light sleepers. (never a major problem though)

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: canfamabroad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Tilsitt for 3 days, and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The room was a good size( we stayed in a regular double), clean, nicely decorated with a good sized bathroom. The staff was exceptional, very friendly, and knowledgeable, ready to help at any turn. We took the breakfast and in spite of it being a little pricey, enjoyed the quality and selection. The location was great, and easily found from the Metro stop. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A higher-end 3 star hotel close to Champs Elysees”
Reviews.Author: cuisineducoeur
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here over the long weekend for two nights, three days. As previous posts mention, the reception speaks excellent English and will not drag their feet to make reservations for you (an experience I have had many times over in French hotels and guesthouses, even of higher ranking). What stood out: - the copious breakfast with real butter croissants (not the dry economical kind), cheese, ham, fresh squeezed OJ (not supermarket OJ), yogurt, cereal, pain au chocolats, toast, jam, butter etc. They also prepare a nice tray for you to have in your room which we did once but realized if we ate in the breakfast room we could refill on OJ as much as we wanted -the comforters were thick and fluffy, not the thin fleecy kind that you find in most 3 star hotels in Paris. While they were not quite down-feather material, they were definitely a notch above their competition - free Internet in the lobby - bath products were nice, actually had a nice bottle of lotion as well as fresh rose petals strewn about

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Angelikapomadora
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location. It's right in the heart of Paris but in a little side street so still quiet enough not to be disturbed at night. The staff were very friendly and Manuel went that extra mile to be helpful. We arrived sooner than expected and were able to check in early. The room was a good size, clean and bed was so comfortable! The facilities were great and we got a great deal via Travelzoo. Highly recommended for quality, price and location. Definitely stay here again when next in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not the best”
Reviews.Author: anirban.iimc
Reviews.Content: During my stay in Paris this summer I stayed at the Tilsitt for 2 nights. Based on the raving reviews of the property I had read on this site, I was anticipating a premier hotel. After all, it is not easy to be ranked among the top 10 hotels in Paris!! However, I am sorry to say but the sight of the hotel and then the room is a little disappointing. Given it's location, exceptional service, clean and tidy rooms and an overall inviting friendly atmosphere, this place is definitely worth recommending. But I think it is also important that the expectations be set right. The hotel is a tiny property clubbed with several other identical looking hotels in an alley near Champs Elysees. The roms are just big enough to accomodate two beds and a couple of suitcases. The 'sit-out' is really a two feet by 4 feet extension which can agt best be called an 'opening', looking into other buildings. Even the photo shop across the street had not heard of the hotel. Much that I was impressed with the staff and the set-up, this is just another hotel in my mind. I could not get booking for another day's stay and had to check into the Concorde La Fayette. While the service may not be as personalized etc etc, the rooms are of a different league. And when you get the Concorde for the same price as Tilsitt, I would definitely pick the former, if only because I like spreading my legs and watching the Eiffel from the 20th floor while I sip my wine. But if you want a place bang on Champs Elysees and are ok with smaller rooms - or even if big hotels put you off, Tilsitt is a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: mchelenblue
Reviews.Content: Good location, good breakfast and good service. for a weekend for three women sharing a room. The beds were clean and comfortable and the towels white and fluffy. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room, however, when we requested a kettle, this was provided at no extra cost along with coffee, tea and sugar. Manual speaks very good English and goes out of his way to help you. Would definately stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: trixy24
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through a Travelzoo deal and the money we saved was a bonus to an absolutely perfect stay. The hotel is very modern but not clinical, I would describe it as quirky and chic. Very french. It is charming in every detail, from the wonderful receptionists Manuel and Fanny who could not have done more to make us feel welcome, to the quintessential french breakfast which we chose to have served in our room each morning. Our room was lovely and plenty big enough. Everywhere was clean and fresh. The hotel is literally 2 minutes walk from L'arc de Triomphe and walking distance to many other attractions inc the Eiffel Tower, it took us about 15 mins to walk there in the sunshine. Overall, it is a wonderful, friendly hotel and met our needs in every way. It is a perfect place to stay for a trip to Paris because of it's location, it's decor, it's staff and it's atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Tilsitt Etoile Paris”
Reviews.Author: Helenishka
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Perfect location, very friendly and helpful hotel staff. Rooms are nice. I wish we stayed lonegr but that was a very short trip. Next time we come to Paris, we'll definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: linduguapa
Reviews.Content: When our flight was rerouted through Paris, we sought the advice of the CDG airport info booth to find a hotel. They recommended the Hotel Tilsitt because of the location and its great reviews. We were a group of 4 adults and a baby, and arrived to find they didn't have two double rooms available as it said on the computer at the airport. They agreed to charge the same price to put us in two singles and one double (which was fine with us). They offered a child bed for the baby. They showed us the rooms before we made our decision. The front desk was extremely friendly, helpful, spoke english, and were very accomodating in recommending sights to see during our 24 hours in Paris. The single room I stayed in was cute and charming, with a window with a beautful wrought iron gate. My two-year old enjoyed making echoes out of the window. Since our luggage didn't arrive, the heated towel rack was wonderful to dry our handwashed clothes. The bathroom was beautiful with fresh flower petals and a nice tub. The only negative I can say about the hotel is that I could hear my neighbor speaking loudly on the phone while we were trying to sleep, finally he went out and we didn't hear him anymore. The breakfast was my favorite of my entire week in Europe. The patries and breads were delicious as was the coffee. My two-year old had plenty of options between the breads, hot chocolate, yogurt, hard boiled brown eggs, and juice. Breakfast was served in a beautiful stone walled basement with a view of a small fountain. Also -- free internet in the lobby for guests! A wonderful place to stay, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gilamonyet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend and my parents for the easter weekend. This hotel is great its close to the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. While being close to such heavily visited things in Paris youre staying in a peacefull street so no loud noise from outside or what so ever. The rooms arent big but there great for couples. It was more cozy then it was annoying. Also at the arrival the rooms where nicely cleaned and the mini bar was filled with enough drinks. Enough towels, soap and a VERY clean bathroom! The breakfast was great. Alot of different food you can eat such as fruit, yogurt, bread, croissaints and some other france delights. Also there's a constant supply of Jus d'orange while having breakfast. They even made a 'special dishes' because it was easter The staff was very friendly and helpfull. The staff that worked at kitchen for breakfast worked really hard to keep the supply of food constant and they also were very friendly if you asked for something else. The staff behind the desk where realy helpfull and friendly. If you ask them the way they will explain it very well its not even possible to get lost with those directions! Also the elevator was broke and we where on the 6th floor one of those people behind the desk had arranged that some-one would carry our suitcase downstairs at the day we left. Next time i got to Paris ill definitely go back to this hotel. Because of the quality i got from my money and the great service! - Dhr. Lefeber

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: TheRoyOfTheRovers
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with four or five rooms over each floor, and approx. five floors altogether. It is a typical Paris building of its type expertly converted for use as a hotel (including lift, separate restaurant/breakfast room, and bar). The rooms appear to be a little small, and maybe this also accounts for not very good soundproofing as regards one of the rooms adjoining us. However, the room and the hotel were generally very clean, and the bathroom facilities were excellent. Breakfast facilities were also very good. The impression gained is that everything is very organised and runs smoothly, and the reception staff were friendly and helpful. There were one or two nice little touches as well. The general decor was contemporary or modern in style, whilst the room was more traditional. Possibly, the only thing that would prevent us returning to this hotel was the location. Although very central and situated in a quiet street close to the Arc de Triomphe, this was our first visit to Paris and nex time we would probably prefer to be located on the eastern side of the city. If the location suits, I would not hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrownsFan40
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Paris 3 to 4 times a year on business for the past 8 or 9 years. During that time I have stayed at a minimum of 7 or 8 different hotels, always looking for the one that offers that rare combination of convenient location, reasonable room rates, an accommodating staff, air conditioning, and easy access to good restaurants. About 2 years ago, I discovered the Tilsitt and immediately stopped looking elsewhere. The Tilsitt staff is friendly and helpful, and especially welcoming to Americans that stay with them. The Tilsitt is also easy and inexpensive to get to from CDG Airport by taking the Malliot / Etoile Air France bus to the 2nd stop. From there it's less than a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BredaK
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Paris and feel compelled to tell everyone about this hotel. It is a lovely boutique hotel in a very central location near the Champs Elysees. I have stayed in Paris hotels in the past and have found them adequate. This hotel is of a very high standard, The rooms are very nice. The staff are very helpful and genuinely friendly. Everyone from the Receptionists to the very nice man who poured our drinks at night made our stay an exceptionally pleasant experience. Just walk out the door of the hotel and the Arc de Triomph is within view in a few minutes. The metro stations are within 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The open top tour bus can be taken nearby. The Champs Elysees is readily available for those who wish to shop. Don't bypass this hotel if you intend to stay in Paris. Oh by the way it is very reasonable also - wont break the bank. But it is quality and value for money. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!”
Reviews.Author: kchuscavage
Reviews.Content: Great price, excellent breakfast, great rooms, and very helpful nice staff! Loved the 24-hour bar area and hotel is very close to everything! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Like your home But in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FonsecaBrazil
Reviews.Content: Great service , full service , excelent facilities inside and around the hotel , few steps from main turistcs points and main subway stations , estrategicaly located.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: ManuelMilano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a very good position near Champs Elysees. It has charm , very clean , friendly staff. Whether you are on vacation or for business , I would recommend this hotel for the excellent price and quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: alq1984
Reviews.Content: With a romantic backdrop like Paris, I didnt expect anything less with our hotel. Very close to the Arc de Triomphe, the hotel was easy to find, and close to a Metro stop. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by the nicest and most helpful staff I may have ever encountered in a hotel! The hotel was quaint, cute, and clean. The WiFi worked in the lobby, and staying on the top floor was great. I suggest requesting the top floor so you do not have to hear the people above you. We did have a minor incident where we could here the people next door, but it didnt dampen our experience. The bathroom was clean, and the room was small but wonderful. Since we spent most of our time exploring, we didn't need a palace to stay in, it was just perfect. Breakfast was fine, and again the staff was more than willing to help with catching a cab, recommending resaurants, and answeing any questions. If I ever go back to Paris, I will for sure stay at this hotel, because it was affordable and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great location and super price”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryNoriega
Reviews.Content: Wifi worked, breakfast was delivered to our room and it was good. I really liked how our room had a split bathroom. Take a look at our pictures :) It's a very family friendly place and we stayed at other hotels in paris and you will not find this kind of room at this price. We found that there was no need for a view, our room was nicely lit with natural diffused light.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, brilliant area”
Reviews.Author: TravellingChic
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Tilsitt hotel in Jan 08. We were pleasantly surprised by the interior. The reception room leads to the bar lounge area, which is very nicely decorated. Although we rarely saw a bar tender present. The lift is very small so bear this in mind if you have lots of luggage. We only stayed a night so it wasn't a problem. If you walk down the stairs, you'll notice the hard wood floors on the ground floor. Really lovely. The room itself, we stayed on the second floor. Judging by the fire escape floor plan, we had the biggest room on the floor. It's not massive but big enough to walk around. There is a small flat screen TV attached to the wall. A desk and chair; a closet with safe and mini bar fridge, extra blankets. The bed was well made with mint chocolates on the cushions. We had a balcony overlooking the street, lovely although a little noisy at times. The bathroom was clean. A hairdryer is attached to the wall. It can get a little noisy in the mornings as you can hear people upstairs talking and walking around. The road is quite quiet apart from the odd moped going by noisily, but not really a major problem. There is free wifi in the lobby area. And a free PC to use if you don't have your own laptop. Alternatively you can buy a Wifi card fo use it in your room. The area was great! There are so many restaurants to choose from in the area. There are also retail shops nearby, such as Gap, NAFNAF, Habitat. We had a hard time choosing where to eat. Don't bother with the Thai place though, we were very disappointed with it! There is also a BNP Paribas bank nearby to withdraw money. And it's a 5 minute walk to the Charles de Gaulles metro station. This is a well placed hotel, very reasonably priced. We walked to the Louvre, which was about 2 miles away! The Eiffel Tower is just across the Seine. It has everything you need. There is a nearby crepe cafe or a bakery if you miss breakfast. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Home feel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yvette1203
Reviews.Content: GOOD points: * The location is good, as near the Arch + the famous road * The hotel is clean * The reception ma ma is very nice * Free of linking to The internet is good BAD points: * Had better be well-prepared for Hot Pot

Reviews.Title: “Best placed but not best priced.”
Reviews.Author: chau7
Reviews.Content: The room was too small and also the bed. The breakfast was very good. People at front desk are very helpfull. It's a very good place close to Arc the Triumph and Champ Elysees. In this area there are a lot of bars en restaurants to eat good food. Subway and Bus access at a block distance from the Hotel. Best placed but not best priced.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were lovely and they treated us so very well there. Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: queencharlottesandy
Reviews.Content: This was great experience. We were told the rooms in Paris were small and cramped but these rooms were lovely, fairly roomy and very very clean. The people at the desk were so helpful...they went above and beyond in so many ways. We highly recommend it and would go back in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, nice, nice”
Reviews.Author: manny25Ny
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor has been for years a great help when it comes to pick up for a hotel. And this was not an exception, found a great deal in their website and had a great surprise. The location is fantastic, the hotel cute-cool-gorgeous...and the staff just amazing! We received a treatment we were not expecting, and honestly don't remenber being in another hotel with such a high customer's oriented service...don't miss that guy at the reception! I will definetly come back, I have already reccomended!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: autumntripper
Reviews.Content: A welcoming friendly Hotel, very conveniently placed. Our room was small but perfectly formed with everything we needed. Breakfast was excellent and all the staff pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: barbara33Maine/Mex
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two great things going for it-- the location and the staff. Manuel is everything others have mentioned; multilingual, helplful, charming, etc. but the rest of the staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable, too. We even received a totally unexpected "thank you" note and gift for having stayed there from the manager. What's not to like? It delivers value for price, and people do go out of their way to fulfill your needs. Thank you, Tilsitt, you fulfilled our needs admirably.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: latravelqueen17
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Tilsitt upon arriving in Paris for the weekend and then again on the tail end of our trip before we returned home. The staff is very, very nice and helpful and accommodating. You couldn't ask for a better location. While very convenient to everything, it is located on a side street so there is not much traffic and noise. We rented two rooms that opened onto a terrace on the ground floor. Very nice. Small rooms but typical for Europe. Nice bathrooms with bathtub and comfortable beds. Breakfast was nice and the staff working the breakfast was very friendly. It was clean and nice. I would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute treasure!”
Reviews.Author: A_Stokes
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all of those travellers who had visited and rated this hotel previously, because it was your kind words that led my husband and I to this absolute treasure! We could not have been more happy with our stay, particularly the assistance we received upon our arrival from the reception staff, in particular, Manuel. If you are fortunate enough to meet him during your stay, you can be assured that you will be in very friendly and safe hands. Manuel checked us into a delightful room on the top floor with lovely views over the roofs of Paris, it also had lovely little walk out balconies to help breathe in the atmosphere. It is without a doubt the biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in Paris. The decor lovely and typically Parisian, making it perfect for our stay. We were merely minutes from the Metro and the gorgeous Arc De Triumph, making our stay even more magnificient. The staff couldn't have been more helpful with our enquiries and fulfilling any need we had during our stay. Quite frankly I can't recommend this place enough and will be telling anyone who listens to stay there. It is worth every single Euro! I also want to drop a special note to the staff to say thank you for returning my brand new designer sunglasses I had bought at the beginning of my trip. I accidently left them behind in the Reception Bar of the hotel, and they promptly returned them to me at NO CHARGE to my home in Australia. I couldn't have been more grateful for their kind and considerate customer service. Bless you Hotel Tilsett Etoile you made our holiday! Can't wait to go back! Alison - Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: anneHerts
Reviews.Content: I don't normally give reviews but the service we received from the receptionist in printing my on line booking prompted me to do something in return. Great location for Arc de Triomphe/Champs Elysee. Bedroom smallish but charming - we were on top floor with eaved ceiling and nice rooftop views. French style with character. I intend returning next year with my mother to celebrate her XX birthday and have already recommended this hotel to a colleague.

Reviews.Title: “Restful stay, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: layas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned last week from our very first trip to Paris. We stayed, based on the recommendations of other Trip Advisor members, at the Hotel Tilsitt Etoile. This was the perfect place for us. We really were expecting a tiny little room, but there was plenty of room for us and our suitcases - kind of wished we'd have brought more! There was a safe in the room and a shower with great hot water. Our room overlooked 2 different courtyards and the view was pleasant. The bed was awesome - not a backache one single night! As previously stated, there is a grocery store 1/2 block away, with basic supplies. Plus there is a market just 2-3blocks north on Rue Poncelet each morning with deli meats, bakers, pastries, coffee, fresh produce, cheese etc. We got breakfast here each morning and enjoyed an eclair from Stubli (an awesome pastry shop) while watching this neighborhood market function. We also got our lunches here, bread and meat and cheese for our day and ate in one of Paris' awesome parks (our favorite is Luxembourg) The staff were great - always friendly and helpful, even volunteering to print my boarding passes for me - thanks Manuel! The wireless internet is free on your pc or theirs in the lobby, so we used it there, rather than paying in our room. We really liked the location too - just 2-3 blocks from one of the main metro connection spots in the city, yet still on the edge of a residential area - so we slept every night with our windows open and it was quiet enough to sleep. Plus just a short walk from the Champs-Elysees and more shopping than you can imagine, unless you're from NYC or something!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Tranholme
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel earlier and will continue to use this hotel in the future. The rooms are good, the personnel nice and the location is great. Good price / Quality rating in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElizIreland
Reviews.Content: Small hotel close to the Arc de Triomphe. The weather was unusually warm which can be uncomfortable in small Paris hotel bedrooms but the air conditioning here made it very comfortable (two people, twin room). Also, the room was spotlessly clean - a very good standard 3* hotel, far better than others I have visited on other occasions and I would definitely stay here again. There is a strong impression that the hotel staff care about their customers - arrival greeted with chocolate on the bed, rose petals in the bathroom. Some nice decor touches also (and flat screen TV on the wall). So many hotels just barely 'qualify' for their star rating (usually on something ridiculous like the number of credit cards they accept) but this qualifies on a comfort rating alone. Breakfast room small as expected yet airy and roomy, and service very prompt. Everyone in the hotel - every single person on reception desk plus breakfast room staff and cleaning staff - was very friendly. Checking in and out very efficient. I had booked on the basis of other reviews on TripAdvisor and would agree with the other comments. The location is good for anyone who doesn't want to travel by underground to find a place to eat in the evenings - there are lots of restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel, suiting all budgets. And, of course, walking along the Champs Elysees at night was a good way to end an evening without having to worry about transport back to the hotel. Will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Celticjo58
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms there recently. Due to business commitments we had to change our dates and durations several times. Each change was handled without fuss. Staff were friendly and professional. Hotel is clean and well maintained. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hilltopper1
Reviews.Content: Great location, Champs-Élysées and Arc de Triomphe round the corner, close to Metro. Rather small but clean rooms, must have been renovated recently although some materials look a bit cheap (ceilings). On the other hand you don't find flat screen TV mounted on a wall very often in this kind of hotels. Good size bathrooms. Good minibar. Helpful staff. Tasty breakfast. Quite a lot of noise from the street (dust van on Sunday morning) but if you close windows you are well insulated. We didn't use air conditioning (September) but it must be useful in hot summer days/nights. Overall pretty good hotel - I would recommend it and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Friends-on-tour
Reviews.Content: As four ladies who often lunch, this was our third trip to Paris and our second stay at this hotel. This hotel is in an excellent location being only a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysees and the metro system. It is on a quiet side street with plenty of cafes and restaurants within walking distance. The hotel is clean and comfortable and the staff are polite and friendly especially the lovely Manuel! It makes an excellent base from which to explore the wonderful city of Paris. Many thanks to all who made this yet another enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “What a great choice”
Reviews.Author: SydneyLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading reviews on Tripadvisor. Best thing we ever did. There were 2 adults and 1 child. Even though room was small (we were never there though except to sleep) it was clean and the staff were really friendly. Location is fantastic, easy access to the metro and good places to eat. Price was also good. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfl1900
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was excellent. 2 blocks from the Arc de Triumph The room was very comfortable. The people were very friendly and helpful. Especially Manuel Close by the Tube System This is the 2nd time I have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rivers77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Tilsitt Etoile for the last weekend in July for the last stage of the Tour de France - whilst very disappointed with the organisation of the final leg this hotel more than made up for it! We could not find anything to fault them on, the receptionists were brillant very helpful and informative, the room was briiliant, very clean and a decent size, the maids did their job very well as everything was spotless on our return, the breakfast was very good lots of choice of bread, jams etc. We would certainly recommend a stay at this hotel to anyone well worth the money for location and cleanseliness.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaA1
Reviews.Content: For the last 2 years my boyfriend and I have stayed at hotels recommended by Tripadvisor users. There has never been a problem until now. The hotel is in a great location, a minute from the Arc de Triomphe and a 25 min walk from the Eiffel Tower. It's 3 star, but like a British 2 star. All the staff were lovely apart from one, who i shall discuss with you now! We arrived at midnight from London and went straight to bed. I woke up in the morning to find some red bumps on my hand. By the end of the day i had about 80 bites all over my arms (horrendous huge bites) and a few on my legs and feet. i had clearly been bitten overnight in our room as i woke up with this problem and had been covered up all day as it was a cold overcast day in Paris. that night i asked the receptionist if we could change room. she said no as the hotel was fully booked. i then asked her if she could at least change the bed linen, and she said no as she was the only one on duty! i showed her my bites and she very coldly told me i was probably allergic to my jumper (!?) even though there were bite marks all over me and i've had my jumper for years! she scowled at me when she looked at the bites, offered me no medical help and said this had never happened at the hotel before! the next day i spoke to another receptionist who was much nicer and helpful. he changed our room. when we checked out we found out we were still being charged for a superior room and i had to beg to get 35 Euros off just to be charged the right rate for our room which was ridiculous. other things to note about this hotel. our first morning we went out for breakfast and popped back and found our room was open and was being cleaned (our room was by the reception and bar area). we sat there for 10 minutes and the cleaning lady did not return! anyone could have walked in the room and taken things and who knows how long she was gone for! this is the first time i have ever stayed at a hotel and would say dont go back there. i have no idea what other trip advisor reviewers are writing about, i dont have very high standards so for me to be this critical means something, trust me. we got a superior room (waste of money, still poor quality just more of it!) and the ceilings were so badly done you could see the insulation coming through, i've attached a few pics. All in all this place is worth avoiding. there are loads of hotels in the area, including some chains, given how badly i was bitten i would recommend stearing clear. Aside from this Paris was amazing and here are some tips: - If you fly into Charles de Gaulle the last train into Paris is at 11.56pm. if you miss this like us you'll get stuck with a 70/80 Euro cab journey. the train costs 8 euros but none of the ticket machines take credit cards or euro notes so you must have change for them (there were no open ticket offices and no machines which change notes into coins either). - We got the 'Open Tours' 3 day Paris ticket, great value. you can get unlimited boats to 8 destinations and buses to over 60 (There are 4 different routes). we got the buses everywhere, and they saved us a fortune in travel. - we went to the Louvre at 4pm on the Friday and there was no queue and we walked straight up to the Mona Lisa, no queueing again, i think late in the day and possibly avoiding the weekend is the best time to go, enjoy Paris, but avoid this hotel like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Perfect Central Location, Did Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: harveyFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Paris after spending 3 nights at Tilsett Etoile. I booked this hotel after spending many hours of research and on the strength of the reviews. I was taking my Mum to Paris as a birthday treat and wanted a nice central hotel but at a realistic price. Mum and I were not disappointed with my choice.The hotel is located in a quiet side street just off the Arc and the CDG Etoile Metro. Perfect location for seeing the sights.We had a standard twin room at the front of the hotel, very clean and comfortable and so quiet. Many thanks to all staff who were so attentive especially Manuel who made several phone calls to check tour details, pick ups etc. A real gentleman. They helped to make a mother/daughter trip to Paris very enjoyable. I would definitely return and would recommend booking this hotel rather than some of the more expensive ones, save the money and treat yourself to the Moulin Rouge or the Dining Cruise. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “clean great hotel with an awesome location”
Reviews.Author: boomstick
Reviews.Content: Apologies for this late review, this is coming from the couple from San Francisco, we promised that we would put in a well deserved good word. We stayed at the Hotel Tilsitt for the entire stay in Paris. We're the type of travelers that pretty much only use the hotel to rest and sleep. The hotel itself is pretty small but very clean and "efficient". It's location is great, very close to the subway as well as the arc de triomphe and the champ-elysses. The staff as extremely friendly and helpful. For the value of the money the location cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: robertboon
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a three day stay at Hotel Tilsitt Etoile in Paris. Just five minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe, it is in an excellent location. We had a lovely clean room at the front of the hotel which although slightly noisy at night was certainly compensated by the great location and wonderful attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rl82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for just a short weekend in Paris. We could not rate the hotel high enough. It was perfect for us as the location was real handy with the Arc de Triomphe so close and the metro only a short walk away. The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast was of a high standard with lovely fresh french bed. We will definitly stay at this hotel on return trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Still Happy”
Reviews.Author: Pommes
Reviews.Content: We have previously stayed at this hotel and so was very happy to book another short break here. the hotel is in a very good location, down a very quiet street by the Arc de Triomphe and metro station and a couple of minutes walk from the Champs Elysees. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Hotel is very clean throughout. Rooms are of an adequate size and clean. Continental breakfast very tasty with good choice. Will definately be returning to Paris again and will return to this hotel. Cannot fault the hotel in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ustwa
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant and comfortable stay at this lovely little Hotel. The room we had was a good size , with a large ensuite great shower (Room 65) while our other travelling companions rooms were a bit smaller and they didnt have the same size ensuite but we all agreed that it was a good choice. Fresh linen daily. The very helpfull staff made it a happy stay. They spoke good english (and other languages that we cannot vouch for). Extremely helpful with all the tourists questions and advice given when required. Always aimed to please. The breakfast was good value for the 12 eur. The Buffet consisted of Juice, cereals, bread, toasted, croissants, yogurt, fruit salad, hard boiled egg, cheeses, ham, and danishes...Tea ,coffee Location is good and the metro just a short walk away. Lovely restaurants close by that all served just great cusine (even a self service restaurant at a very reasonable cost) It is within strolling distance of the Arc de Triomph. The down side was the room lacked tea/coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ENELondon
Reviews.Content: A small comfortable hotel, very convenient for the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysee. Very friendly helpful staff, particularly Manuel, many thanks. An excellent continental breakfast inclusive. In all very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Tilsitt Etoile - a family-friendly oasis in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bullrunner40
Reviews.Content: My family (self, wife and two children) spent three days in Paris as part of a longer tour of Europe, and we selected the Tilsitt Etiole largely based on the high ratings of the hotel from TripAdvisor and other sites. Happy to report that the ratings were justified - the Tilsitt Etoile was everything we hoped it would be and more. The room (a quad) was very spacious for Europe, and the location (a two-minute walk from the Arc du Triomphe) couldn't be beat. The desk staff was friendly and helpful, the breakfast delicious and the experience first-rate. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed staying at the Tilsitt this August”
Reviews.Author: rallen3214
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Tilsitt from 13th -20th August 2007 and enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is extremely good value for money and it is in a quiet and convenient location (near the Arc de Triomphe and the metro) . Although fairly small (although this is standard for Paris) our room was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good with friendly service (taken in a very pleasant basement dining room). The staff at the hotel desk were all excellent - very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English (although they were kind enough to pretend to understand our French !). We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My vication in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Graph
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years my wife and I spent our vacation in your hotel. We were to point out that on each visit we were treated exceptionally well and your service was excellent. In particular, during our last visit in June 2007, your Mr. Manual Da Silva helped us exceedingly in making our vacation an enjoyable one. May your hotel continue to be succsful in the future

Reviews.Title: “Merci Hotel Tilsitt”
Reviews.Author: WolverineAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris by train from Amsterdam and taxied to the hotel. The hotel staff was extremely accomodating and knowlwdgeable. I have told many friends about our desk clerk, who was so helpful, He knew 5 languages! (I am still working on English.) The hotel's location is very convenient, just around the corner from the Arch de Triumphe, and also the Metro station right there (just 2 blocks away) made access to the many Paris attractions easily accessible. The Cathedral at Notre Dame, the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay were all easy to reach. As one from the United States who'd never visited Paris before, we had some concerns about how we would be received, but everyone was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were (especially after Amsterdam) very nice and comfortable, On our final day we took the Metro to the Eiffel Tower, walked across to the Tuilleries Gardens (please forgive my spelling) and then down the Champs Elyesse (again please forgive my spelling) to the Arch. It was wonderful. All within easy access of the hotel. Also, there are some nice restaurants and some small groceries close by which was very helpful. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bobmij
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Tilsett for our anniversary. We've been to Paris several times before but found this hotel to be the best so far. A stones throw from the Arc de Triomphe and straight onto the sights. The hotel staff were excellent from the moment we arrived, the room was clean and airy and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was continental, but plenty of it. Croissant, Paint au chocolat, bread, rolls, cheese, ham, egg etc. the fresh fruit salad was particularly good. I have to add it had good coffee. We will stay there again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Paris”
Reviews.Author: platanetree
Reviews.Content: This a very cozy and beautiful hotel, located very near Champs-Élysées and the Arc de Triomphe. The overall decoration is very nice and modern. The service is excellent. My room (a triple one) had 4 separate beds, with enough space for leaving the suitcases opened and walk through. It has a very clean, new and comfortable toilettes. The personal is warm and super profesional. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tilsitt ! What else ?”
Reviews.Author: reservoirdoll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Paris last July. We picked the hotel Tilsitt Etoile on Tripadvisor and all we can say is we have made the PERFECT choice. The hotel is central in a very safe area. Rooms and bathrooms are clean (with shower curtain it would be even better). Many metro lines leave from the station just next to the hotel. Gail and Pascal at the desk are so delightful ! It was a real pleasure to talk to them (and to ask them my 1.000.000 questions !!!) I highly recomand this place to anyone to have an unforgettable times in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “home from home”
Reviews.Author: JayceeHampshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Great Location Great value for Money Easy access to Metro Clean / Comfortable Room Friendly / Helpful Staff especially Manuel Would have no hesitation recommending this Hotel for a great base to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Paris, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Family22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centre-located just a few meters away from the Arc du Triomph and the metro station. The 4-bed-room was clean, wonderfully furnished and large enough for 4 people. The breakfast was fantastic with freshly-made fruit salad and many tasteful foods. There was a pc where you could connect to the net for free. The staff was really friendly and helpful. I’d definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: McGooPerth
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 5 (2 adults and 3 children aged 6, 11 & 15) travelling from Australia. We found the Hotel Tilsitt to be very hospitable, being extremely clean and well kept - the rooms were more than adequate, peaceful and quiet. We found the staff to be wonderful, very friendly and helpful. The location is great and I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Paris is always great”
Reviews.Author: Chocaholics
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Quad Room with two kids (12 & 8). Room adequate in size and one of the few hotels in central Paris apparently able to accommodate a family. Hotel is close to Metro and is good base for Paris attractions via Metro. Champs Elysee also close at hand. Hotel is boutique style - that is it is compact. Hotel clean and modern and accurately described on website.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, uncomfortable room”
Reviews.Author: NeelieH
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Tilsitt Etoile from 27-31 July 2007. The staff were very helpful giving us tips on local restaurants and even helping us book tickets for our onward journey. Unfortunately the room we stayed in was most disappointing. We were expecting it to be small as is usual in Paris but our room was tiny with barely enough space to walk around. Disconcertingly, the toilet in the en suite bathroom was jammed into a corner making it most uncomfortable to use (wall jutting out in front of your knees...). The air conditioning in the room was also unsatisfactory. It was quite warm in Paris during our stay and even with the a/c on the room was stuffy and we both found it difficult to sleep. As our room was at the back we also had to listen to construction work going on in the courtyard. Although this stopped at the weekend it started at 8am on weekdays. If you're going to stay in Hotel Tilsitt Etoile make sure you ask for one of their larger rooms and at the front of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff makes all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: 2jy
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by friendly staff and clean comfortable rooms. Our request for a double bed was handled quickly and pleasantly. We will stay at this hotel again as it is an easy walk from the metro and around the corner from shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: webzack
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Great Rooms, Great Prices, Great Location. Recommended for anyone going to Paris with a budget of 100-200 euro's a night for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: welshrarebits
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 1st Aug - 5th Aug 2007 after reading the reviews on trip advisor. It was our 1st year wedding anniversary and needed to be special and i can truely say we had a wonderful time there and would recommend it. We emailed the hotel regarding transfers and we had a response immediately! Our room was on the fifth floor and had a double balcony, which was wonderful. The room was smallish but had everything that you needed (apart from a kettle for us brits that like a cup of tea!) The staff in the hotel were very approachable and spoke english, which was a great help, nothing was too much trouble! The breakfast was included in the price and set you up for a day of sight-seeing in Paris! The location of the hotel was wonderful, only a short walk to the Arch de Triomphe, Champs-Elyees and the open top bus, a must for getting around Paris. At the back of the hotel is a supermarket and a pizza place, good cheap food and drink!! If in Paris again we would truely stay here again, excellent value for money and the staff there are an asset, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Only good things to say about the Tilsitt Etoile”
Reviews.Author: Elpheba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a long weekend in Paris and were very pleasantly surprised by the Tilsitt Etoile. The hotel is about a 5-minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees and is well-located for exploring the city. It is also close to several metro stations, including Ternes on line 2, which will take you to the Gar du Nord train station. Our room (#61) was on the top floor and was large by Paris standards. We had two sets of french doors which opened on to two small balconies overlooking the surrounding rooftops - the breeze at night was wonderful. The room was clean and bright with a mini bar, flat screen tv and bright en-suite bathroom. The staff was exceptionally friendly and were very willing to provide help and information if needed. Although I can't comment on the breakfast itself, the breakfast room was large and charming. Some final brief things worth mentioning: chocolates on the pillows, a selection of daily papers (English and French), available internet and wifi, luggage storage for after check-out, quiet neighbourhood. All in all, a great value for your euro!

Reviews.Title: “A big recommandation!”
Reviews.Author: pattyn_nv
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say a few words about the hotel tilsitt étoile. Years ago I needed to go to Paris for business on a regular basis. Wich untill this day I stil have to do sometimes. I like to be close to the places I need to go, don't want to pay gastronomic bills but stil want to enjoy the necessairy comfort. I found that in hotel tilsitt, it is in the centre of Paris, I allways feel welcome and I have all the comfort that I need. There is internetconnection for laptops on the room, tv, mini bar, etc... everything is very neat and clean... oh and, each morning a great typical french breakfast! On top of that, you can really taste the french culture in that hotel. I find it a big recommendation to anybody that wants/needs to travel and who is price conscious. My kind regards to the staf of Hotel Tilsitt étoile, and I see you back on my next businesstrip to Paris! Kind regards Tom Pattyn

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful - highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Simmeec
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room (2 adults + 1 child) which was really fabulous. A terrific location, close to the Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysses and Metro. It was so good that we came again. Although our room was smaller (very short notice), we still enjoyed our stay. The staff were very helpful. A very special thank you Manuel! We have already recommended this hotel to many of our friends, and if we make it to Paris again, we'll definitely book it in as a great place to rest our weary heads! Thanks, Simone, Rohan and Hannah.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: smileyface4
Reviews.Content: We had the most fantastic time in Paris which was topped off by the hotels fantastic accommodation and helpful service from all members of staff, especially Manuel on reception, whom when asked gave great advice. See you all very soon. Diane Hickman

Reviews.Title: “nice little hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Peoriakmh
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the this hotel. We arrived mid-morning (before the stated check-in time) and our rooms weren't ready, but we were able to check our luggage and go out and explore the city for awhile. In the meantime, the hotel put our rooms at the top of the list to get ready. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but very clean and otherwise nice. One downside, when we booked, the hotel said it had triples available (we had five people traveling). The "triple" was actually a double room with an extra, twin-sized "bed." I use parentheses, because that extra bed was very hard and not very comfortable. The location of the hotel was very nice - there were lots of nearby cafes, restaurants and even a mini-market. Also, it was about 2-3 blocks from the Metro, the Arc de Triomphe and Avenue of Champ-Elysse. What really made this hotel stand out and rank above average for me was the staff, particularly Manuel, who was extremely helpful, not only with the accommodations, but also with tips on restaurants, sites, tours and getting around the city. I would definitely return to this hotel next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bubblychumbs
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel tilsitt, Paris. The staff were very friendly especially the male receptionist. The hotel was perfectly located, a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and its metro station. Overall we had a brilliant stay in Paris which was amplified by how well we were treated in Hotel Tilsitt.

Reviews.Title: “Would gladly return”
Reviews.Author: jacquel_29
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on location - and what a fabulous location it is! This hotel is minutes away from the Metro and the RER, Arc de Triomphe, Champs Elysee and a lovely walk to some nearby parks. There are some great restaurants nearby and convenience stores. However, the thing that will ensure our return to the hotel is the amazing service we received from the staff. They were all so attentive; polite and friendly but also wonderful to share a joke with. A small inconvenience with a baby cot was attended to immediately; a taxi was booked as we requested and daily our room was cleaned thoroughly. Our room had a courtyard (lovely) and was big enough to sleep two adults and our 2 year old son. We would stay here again in a heartbeat. A special thanks to Manuel and Pascal amongst others for your amazing service. You are all a wonderful credit to the service industry in Paris. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ukelele
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a "family-friendly hotel" in Central Paris and subsequently booked a quadruple room at this establishment following advice from TripAdvisor members. We were not disappointed. It's great for small families; both our kids (ages 7 and 12) enjoyed their stay. The room had all the basic amenities, from a safety deposit box to satellite TV and mini bar. The location is excellent, just ten minutes walk to the Charles de Gaulle-Etoile Metro station, which is a mini hub for RER A and various other Metro lines. The RER A gave us direct access to Eurodisney, a 40 minute train ride away and stops right in front of the Park's gates. The hotel itself is in a quiet street off Avenue de Wagram, and there are various restaurants and convenience shops around the area. The staff is fantastic, spoke perfect English, and were very helpful with our various queries regarding transport and city attractions. All in all, a memorable stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: J-N-London
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights over the Bastille Day weekend, having taken advice from Parisian associates on which area would be best to stay in and a short list of hotels to choose from. We were very happy with our choice of Tilsitt Etoile, which we booked on the Internet and took advantage of an incentive deal. It is fantastically convenient to Etoile (and the Bastille parade, Metro lines, Champs Elysees etc.). The room was air conditioned, and comfortable, though fairly small, as is common, and the air conditioner was virtually imperceptible on the low setting at night time - also no traffic or other noise. We were on the front on the 4th floor. There was a flat screen tv with satellite channels including BBC 24. Pascal, who we saw on arrival, was fantastically helpful with our tourist arrangements for Bastille Day, telling us where and when to see the big parade best, where and when to go to see the evening open-air concert and fireworks display, he suggested a choice of resturants near to the evening event, booked our choice for us, and printed out a clear map to find it. Given we got a three-nights-for-two deal and the price seems very competitive anyway for a ***, this was really excellent service. Everyone else was friendly too, the room was nicely furnished and kept very clean. Small bath with handheld shower, as usual. Would certainly consider again and recommend it if it is in the right quarter of the city. Underground 24 hour car park within 200 yards. Loads of restaurants and cafes and a small supermarket immediately around.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muldr4Scly
Reviews.Content: I needed a central hotel for a couple of nights. After much searching on TripAdvisor I found this hotel with alot of positive reviews. When I arrived in Paris I did notice there were 3 hotels all on the same street with similar names so be sure to get the right one! The hotel is very quiet, especially being so centrally located. I had a nice flatscreen TV, comfortable bed. The room was a bit on the small side but for about £70 a night, in the middle of summer, in such a great location, I would consider this hotel a good find! The Charles De Gaulle metro station is just a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel we always choose when visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: hersoton
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travel to Paris most years, and have always chosen to stay at the Tilsitt ever since it was recommended to us by a travel agent about ten years ago. We are always made to feel extremely welcome, and the rooms (although small in true Parisienne style) are always comfortable and well presented, with everything you need. The mini bar contains soft drinks and reasonably priced cold beer. New additions in our room this year were flat screen TV (multichannel although only BBC World and one sport channel in English), and excellent power showers. We used opt for the buffet breakfast which offers a reasonable choice although is arguably overpriced at 12 euros - but increasingly we tend to just pick up a croissant and coffee in a nearby cafe after we head out for the day. Teatrays are not in all the rooms, but are available on request. Bring your own coffee and milk (and tea bags if you like your tea anything other than very weak), but even having the kettle and mugs is really handy, and an excellent and unusual bonus in France! Its location, in a quiet street but just five minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the neighbouring Charles de Gaule metro/RER station, is perfect. It's also just a ten minute walk from the Champs Elysees. If you can't be bothered to walk/ride too far to eat, (especially the evening you arrive) we recommend Chez Clement which is open till aroun midnight and has about ten branches across Paris. It has eccentric French country house decor and excellent food (duck rotisierre with mash is a personal favourite). There is a branch just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel in Avenue Wagram (turn left out of the top end of Rue Brey and you will find it on your left after a minutes walk). For that essential glass of vin blanc or vin rouge there is a huge choice of pavement bars and cafes in nearby streets, but our favourite drinking location (an easy 10- 15 minutes walk away), is the 33rd floor bar at the top of the Concorde Hotel, 3, Place du Général Koenig, which has the most spectacular views over Paris. If you can time your visit to coincide with sunset so much the better. Drinks are NOT cheap, but with this view just drink slowly and enjoy!! Finally further afield our other favourite Parisienne haunt is the Resurant Grand Colbert, 2 rue Vivienne, which takes you back into the 'Belle Epoque' ambience of the early twentieth century as well as offering excellent food at a good price. Definitely a great location for a special occasion dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: geebes2
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel situated very near to the Arc De Triomphe. From our experience the neighbourhood was safe and peaceful, with easy access to the metro and Champs-Elysees. With any city hotel you get the odd background noise of city life. The rooms are slightly small, but from what I gathered above average for a modest Parisian hotel. Very clean, modern decoration/flooring etc, good breakfast, and very very helpful staff. A real bargin, considering the excellant location/cleaniness and price. We would definitely go back and recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Travel247Scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend break in Paris. The hotel was easily located from the metro station and a fantastic central spot. The hotel room was quite small but what do you expect for the price! It was spotlessly clean and provided all the amenities we could have asked for. The staff were very friendly and helpful at all times. The Arc de Triomphe is only a 2 minutes walk from the hotel as is the metro station where you can access all the other sights of Paris.The surrounding area has many good restaurants and bars and I found it to be a very safe location at any time, day or night. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone. Great find!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Borka
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours on internet looking for a decent, clean and reasonably priced hotel in Paris, not too far from major attractions. Well, it was worthed. Me and my friend stayed in Paris for 6 unforgettable days in May and Hotel Tilsitt Etoile fulfiled all our expectations. I can only repeat after the other guests: rooms are very clean (we had one on the 5th floor), bathroom spotless, breakfast plentiful, metro 5 minutes away, neighborhood quiet, the bus stop for the CDG airport in a walking distance... And of course the staff is really very friendly. Special thanks and best regards to Manuel at the reception desk! The only a bit disturbing thing was that we can hear the water runing from the bathroom near or perhaps above us. But anyway - I certainly would (and hopefuly will) choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: skemmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a business trip. The staff were really helpful on my arrival. The man on reception spoke excellent English and was very welcoming. The room, on the top (6th) floor was very clean and of a decent size. Bed was comfortable and the a/c was working and efficient. Bathroom was good and very clean again. No view from the windows though, just the backs of other buildings. For a three start hotel, in an excellent location - 1 minute to Arc De Triomphe, it was perfect for my needs. Breakfast was 12 euros and of a decent quality, but perhaps was the only weakness. Still, I did get there at 10 am as it was closing. Would strongly recommend for business travel and for leisure breaks - well, there are lots of bars and restaurants nearby, Metro 1 minute walk and the Eiffel Tower only a very pleasant 20 min stroll.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bauer2628
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel with a group last april for the "Marathon de Paris" and I had a lot of trouble (my luggages have been lost, my wallet stolen...). My stay could have been terrible because of that, but the staff have been really helpfull. When we arrived on the friday morning, the lady at the desk spent so much time with me to call the airport as I could not find anybody speaking english or german. Then on saturday the same girl called the police for us and explained how to go there to report what happens. Thanks to her for eveything. The location of the hotel is so good, you can go everywhere by all metros lines going from "charles de gaule etiole" The hotel was good, even if we were waiting for larger rooms, but it seems this is standard size in Paris. Rooms are very clean and maids are nice. Brekfast is not really good, but if you want to have wonderfull french pastries, then you can go to "Paul" which is just nearby the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: the7farrows
Reviews.Content: Two ladies from each end of the world meeting up after a long freindship, for a weekend in Paris.We could not of picked a better hotel for the price,paid 130 euros for twin bed room.Stayed at the hotel for three nights and it was clean ,comfortable beds and our balcony was the perfect suntrap , sun streaming into our room every morning.The staff were very friendly and accommodating,considering we asked no end of questions. The neighborhood was perfect ,quiet at night but just a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and shopping on the Champs d'Elysees.Walked everywhere but Metro at the top of the road.Don't hesitate about booking this hotel.I would definitely stay here again.Hope I don't have to wait too long

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Tilsitt Etoile Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 23 Rue Brey, 75017 Paris, France
